module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | When creating or updating a cost category, you can define the
--   <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. This
--   rule type adds the flexibility of defining a rule that dynamically
--   inherits the cost category value from the dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs that are based on the value of a specific
--   tag key, first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the
--   tag dimension and specify the tag key to use.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | The name of the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
[$sel:dimensionName:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'] :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName

-- | The key to extract cost category values.
[$sel:dimensionKey:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'] :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionName</a> - The name of
--   the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionKey:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionKey</a> - The key to
--   extract cost category values.
newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | The name of the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionName :: Lens' CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension (Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName)

-- | The key to extract cost category values.
costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionKey :: Lens' CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension.CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension.CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | Use the split charge rule to split the cost of one Cost Category value
--   across several other target values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategorySplitChargeRule
CostCategorySplitChargeRule' :: Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter) -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | The parameters for a split charge method. This is only required for
--   the <tt>FIXED</tt> method.
[$sel:parameters:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter)

-- | The Cost Category value that you want to split. That value can't be
--   used as a source or a target in other split charge rules. To indicate
--   uncategorized costs, you can use an empty string as the source.
[$sel:source:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> Text

-- | The Cost Category values that you want to split costs across. These
--   values can't be used as a source in other split charge rules.
[$sel:targets:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The method that's used to define how to split your source costs across
--   your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
[$sel:method:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters</a> - The parameters for a
--   split charge method. This is only required for the <tt>FIXED</tt>
--   method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_source</a> - The Cost Category value
--   that you want to split. That value can't be used as a source or a
--   target in other split charge rules. To indicate uncategorized costs,
--   you can use an empty string as the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets</a> - The Cost Category values
--   that you want to split costs across. These values can't be used as a
--   source in other split charge rules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:method:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_method</a> - The method that's used to
--   define how to split your source costs across your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
newCostCategorySplitChargeRule :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | The parameters for a split charge method. This is only required for
--   the <tt>FIXED</tt> method.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter))

-- | The Cost Category value that you want to split. That value can't be
--   used as a source or a target in other split charge rules. To indicate
--   uncategorized costs, you can use an empty string as the source.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_source :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule Text

-- | The Cost Category values that you want to split costs across. These
--   values can't be used as a source in other split charge rules.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The method that's used to define how to split your source costs across
--   your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
costCategorySplitChargeRule_method :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule CostCategorySplitChargeMethod
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategorySplitChargeRule.CostCategorySplitChargeRule

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryReference

-- | A reference to a Cost Category containing only enough information to
--   identify the Cost Category.
--   
--   You can use this information to retrieve the full Cost Category
--   information using <tt>DescribeCostCategory</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryReference</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryReference
CostCategoryReference' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryReference

-- | The Cost Category's effective start date.
[$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of unique cost category values in a specific cost category.
[$sel:values:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
[$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
[$sel:processingStatus:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus]

-- | The number of rules that are associated with a specific Cost Category.
[$sel:numberOfRules:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:name:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | The Cost Category's effective end date.
[$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text
[$sel:defaultValue:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryReference</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_effectiveStart</a> - The Cost Category's
--   effective start date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_values</a> - A list of unique cost category
--   values in a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_costCategoryArn</a> - The unique identifier
--   for your Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingStatus:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_processingStatus</a> - The list of processing
--   statuses for Cost Management products for a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRules:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_numberOfRules</a> - The number of rules that
--   are associated with a specific Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_name</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_effectiveEnd</a> - The Cost Category's
--   effective end date.
--

--   <a>costCategoryReference_defaultValue</a> - Undocumented member.
newCostCategoryReference :: CostCategoryReference

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CoverageHours

-- | How long a running instance either used a reservation or was
--   On-Demand.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageHours</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageHours
CoverageHours' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CoverageHours

--   instance hours that a reservation covered.

--   <a>$sel:onDemandHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_onDemandHours</a> - The number of instance running
--   hours that On-Demand Instances covered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_totalRunningHours</a> - The total instance usage, in
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_reservedHours</a> - The number of instance running
--   hours that reservations covered.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | The amount of instance usage, in normalized units. You can use
--   normalized units to see your EC2 usage for multiple sizes of instances
--   in a uniform way. For example, suppose that you run an xlarge instance
--   and a 2xlarge instance. If you run both instances for the same amount
--   of time, the 2xlarge instance uses twice as much of your reservation
--   as the xlarge instance, even though both instances show only one
--   instance-hour. When you use normalized units instead of
--   instance-hours, the xlarge instance used 8 normalized units, and the
--   2xlarge instance used 16 normalized units.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Modifying Reserved Instances</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Linux Instances</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageNormalizedUnits</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageNormalizedUnits
CoverageNormalizedUnits' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | The number of normalized units that a reservation covers.
[$sel:reservedNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of normalized units that you used.
[$sel:totalRunningNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of your used instance normalized units that a
--   reservation covers.
[$sel:coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances
--   instead of a reservation.
[$sel:onDemandNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CoverageNormalizedUnits</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_reservedNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that a reservation covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_totalRunningNormalizedUnits</a> - The total
--   number of normalized units that you used.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage</a> - The
--   percentage of your used instance normalized units that a reservation
--   covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_onDemandNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances instead of a
--   reservation.
newCoverageNormalizedUnits :: CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | The number of normalized units that a reservation covers.
coverageNormalizedUnits_reservedNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of normalized units that you used.
coverageNormalizedUnits_totalRunningNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of your used instance normalized units that a
--   reservation covers.

--   instead of a reservation.
coverageNormalizedUnits_onDemandNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Coverage

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data Coverage
Coverage' :: Maybe CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe CoverageHours -> Maybe CoverageCost -> Coverage

--   normalized units.

--   that the reservation covered, in normalized units.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageHours:Coverage'</a>, <a>coverage_coverageHours</a> -
--   The amount of instance usage that the reservation covered, in hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageCost:Coverage'</a>, <a>coverage_coverageCost</a> - The
--   amount of cost that the reservation covered.
newCoverage :: Coverage

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval

-- | The time period of the request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDateInterval</a> smart constructor.
data DateInterval
DateInterval' :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | The beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
[$sel:start:DateInterval'] :: DateInterval -> Text

-- | The end of the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:end:DateInterval'] :: DateInterval -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DateInterval</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_start</a> - The
--   beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_end</a> - The end of
--   the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
newDateInterval :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | The beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
dateInterval_start :: Lens' DateInterval Text

-- | The end of the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
dateInterval_end :: Lens' DateInterval Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DateInterval.DateInterval

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2InstanceDetails

-- | Details about the Amazon EC2 instances that Amazon Web Services
--   recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2InstanceDetails</a> smart constructor.
data EC2InstanceDetails
EC2InstanceDetails' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EC2InstanceDetails

-- | Determines whether the recommendation is for a current-generation
--   instance.
[$sel:currentGeneration:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The platform of the recommended reservation. The platform is the
--   specific combination of operating system, license model, and software
--   on an instance.
[$sel:platform:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance family of the recommended reservation.
[$sel:family:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
[$sel:instanceType:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone of the recommended reservation.
[$sel:availabilityZone:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.
[$sel:sizeFlexEligible:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is dedicated or shared.
[$sel:tenancy:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.
[$sel:region:EC2InstanceDetails'] :: EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EC2InstanceDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentGeneration:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_currentGeneration</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommendation is for a current-generation instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_platform</a> - The platform of the recommended
--   reservation. The platform is the specific combination of operating
--   system, license model, and software on an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:family:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_family</a> - The instance family of the
--   recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_instanceType</a> - The type of instance that
--   Amazon Web Services recommends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone of
--   the recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeFlexEligible:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_sizeFlexEligible</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommended reservation is size flexible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tenancy:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_tenancy</a> - Determines whether the recommended
--   reservation is dedicated or shared.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:EC2InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2InstanceDetails_region</a> - The Amazon Web Services Region of
--   the recommended reservation.

--   instance.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceDetails

-- | Details on the Amazon EC2 Resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2ResourceDetails</a> smart constructor.
data EC2ResourceDetails
EC2ResourceDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EC2ResourceDetails

-- | The platform of the Amazon Web Services instance. The platform is the
--   specific combination of operating system, license model, and software
--   on an instance.
[$sel:platform:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of VCPU cores in the Amazon Web Services instance type.
[$sel:vcpu:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The network performance capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.
[$sel:networkPerformance:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The memory capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.
[$sel:memory:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services instance.
[$sel:instanceType:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The disk storage of the Amazon Web Services instance. This doesn't
--   include EBS storage.
[$sel:storage:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The SKU of the product.
[$sel:sku:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the instance.
[$sel:region:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The hourly public On-Demand rate for the instance type.
[$sel:hourlyOnDemandRate:EC2ResourceDetails'] :: EC2ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EC2ResourceDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_platform</a> - The platform of the Amazon Web
--   Services instance. The platform is the specific combination of
--   operating system, license model, and software on an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vcpu:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>, <a>eC2ResourceDetails_vcpu</a> -
--   The number of VCPU cores in the Amazon Web Services instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkPerformance:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_networkPerformance</a> - The network performance
--   capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memory:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_memory</a> - The memory capacity of the Amazon
--   Web Services instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_instanceType</a> - The type of Amazon Web
--   Services instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storage:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_storage</a> - The disk storage of the Amazon Web
--   Services instance. This doesn't include EBS storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sku:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>, <a>eC2ResourceDetails_sku</a> -
--   The SKU of the product.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_region</a> - The Amazon Web Services Region of
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hourlyOnDemandRate:EC2ResourceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceDetails_hourlyOnDemandRate</a> - The hourly public
--   On-Demand rate for the instance type.
newEC2ResourceDetails :: EC2ResourceDetails

-- | The platform of the Amazon Web Services instance. The platform is the
--   specific combination of operating system, license model, and software
--   on an instance.
eC2ResourceDetails_platform :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of VCPU cores in the Amazon Web Services instance type.
eC2ResourceDetails_vcpu :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The network performance capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.
eC2ResourceDetails_networkPerformance :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The memory capacity of the Amazon Web Services instance.
eC2ResourceDetails_memory :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of Amazon Web Services instance.
eC2ResourceDetails_instanceType :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk storage of the Amazon Web Services instance. This doesn't
--   include EBS storage.
eC2ResourceDetails_storage :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The SKU of the product.
eC2ResourceDetails_sku :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the instance.
eC2ResourceDetails_region :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

eC2ResourceDetails_hourlyOnDemandRate :: Lens' EC2ResourceDetails (Maybe Text)

data ESInstanceDetails

--   instance.
[$sel:currentGeneration:ESInstanceDetails'] :: ESInstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The class of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
[$sel:instanceClass:ESInstanceDetails'] :: ESInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
[$sel:instanceSize:ESInstanceDetails'] :: ESInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.
[$sel:sizeFlexEligible:ESInstanceDetails'] :: ESInstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

--   Amazon Web Services recommends.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ForecastResult

-- | The forecast that's created for your query.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newForecastResult</a> smart constructor.
data ForecastResult
ForecastResult' :: Maybe DateInterval -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ForecastResult

-- | The period of time that the forecast covers.
[$sel:timePeriod:ForecastResult'] :: ForecastResult -> Maybe DateInterval

-- | The mean value of the forecast.
[$sel:meanValue:ForecastResult'] :: ForecastResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The upper limit for the prediction interval.
[$sel:predictionIntervalUpperBound:ForecastResult'] :: ForecastResult -> Maybe Text

-- | The lower limit for the prediction interval.
[$sel:predictionIntervalLowerBound:ForecastResult'] :: ForecastResult -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ForecastResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   forecast covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:meanValue:ForecastResult'</a>, <a>forecastResult_meanValue</a>
--   - The mean value of the forecast.
--   
--   <a>$sel:predictionIntervalUpperBound:ForecastResult'</a>,
--   <a>forecastResult_predictionIntervalUpperBound</a> - The upper limit
--   for the prediction interval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:predictionIntervalLowerBound:ForecastResult'</a>,
--   <a>forecastResult_predictionIntervalLowerBound</a> - The lower limit
--   for the prediction interval.
newForecastResult :: ForecastResult

-- | The mean value of the forecast.

-- | The lower limit for the prediction interval.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.GroupDefinition

-- | Represents a group when you specify a group by criteria or in the
--   response to a query with a specific grouping.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroupDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data GroupDefinition
GroupDefinition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe GroupDefinitionType -> GroupDefinition

-- | The string that represents a key for a specified group.
[$sel:key:GroupDefinition'] :: GroupDefinition -> Maybe Text

-- | The string that represents the type of group.
[$sel:type':GroupDefinition'] :: GroupDefinition -> Maybe GroupDefinitionType

-- | Create a value of <a>GroupDefinition</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:GroupDefinition'</a>, <a>groupDefinition_key</a> - The
--   string that represents a key for a specified group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':GroupDefinition'</a>, <a>groupDefinition_type</a> - The
--   string that represents the type of group.
newGroupDefinition :: GroupDefinition

-- | The string that represents a key for a specified group.
groupDefinition_key :: Lens' GroupDefinition (Maybe Text)

-- | The string that represents the type of group.
groupDefinition_type :: Lens' GroupDefinition (Maybe GroupDefinitionType)

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Impact

-- | The dollar value of the anomaly.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newImpact</a> smart constructor.
data Impact
Impact' :: Maybe Double -> Double -> Impact

-- | The cumulative dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
[$sel:totalImpact:Impact'] :: Impact -> Maybe Double

-- | The maximum dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
[$sel:maxImpact:Impact'] :: Impact -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>Impact</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalImpact:Impact'</a>, <a>impact_totalImpact</a> - The
--   cumulative dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxImpact:Impact'</a>, <a>impact_maxImpact</a> - The maximum
--   dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
newImpact :: Double -> Impact

-- | The cumulative dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
impact_totalImpact :: Lens' Impact (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum dollar value that's observed for an anomaly.
impact_maxImpact :: Lens' Impact Double
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Impact.Impact
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Impact.Impact
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Impact.Impact
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Impact.Impact

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues

-- | The metadata that you can use to filter and group your results. You
--   can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensionValues</a> smart constructor.
data DimensionValues
DimensionValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Dimension -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> DimensionValues

-- | The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
[$sel:values:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group
--   your results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
[$sel:key:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe Dimension

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
[$sel:matchOptions:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe [MatchOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>DimensionValues</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:DimensionValues'</a>, <a>dimensionValues_values</a> -
--   The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:DimensionValues'</a>, <a>dimensionValues_key</a> - The
--   names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group your
--   results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:DimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionValues_matchOptions</a> - The match options that you can
--   use to filter your results. <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable
--   for actions related to Cost Category. The default values for
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newDimensionValues :: DimensionValues

-- | The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
dimensionValues_values :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group
--   your results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
dimensionValues_key :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe Dimension)

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
dimensionValues_matchOptions :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe [MatchOption])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.DimensionValues.DimensionValues


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues

-- | The Cost Categories values used for filtering the costs.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> are not specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all Cost
--   Categories. That is, it filters on resources that aren't mapped to any
--   Cost Categories.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the Cost Categories
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it filters on resources without the given
--   Cost Categories key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryValues</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryValues
CostCategoryValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> CostCategoryValues

-- | The specific value of the Cost Category.
[$sel:values:CostCategoryValues'] :: CostCategoryValues -> Maybe [Text]
[$sel:key:CostCategoryValues'] :: CostCategoryValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to cost category.
--   The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and
--   <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
[$sel:matchOptions:CostCategoryValues'] :: CostCategoryValues -> Maybe [MatchOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryValues</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:CostCategoryValues'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryValues_values</a> - The specific value of the Cost
--   Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:CostCategoryValues'</a>, <a>costCategoryValues_key</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:CostCategoryValues'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryValues_matchOptions</a> - The match options that you
--   can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for
--   actions related to cost category. The default values for
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newCostCategoryValues :: CostCategoryValues

-- | The specific value of the Cost Category.
costCategoryValues_values :: Lens' CostCategoryValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategoryValues_key :: Lens' CostCategoryValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to cost category.
--   The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and
--   <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
costCategoryValues_matchOptions :: Lens' CostCategoryValues (Maybe [MatchOption])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryValues.CostCategoryValues

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.MetricValue

-- | The aggregated value for a metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricValue</a> smart constructor.
data MetricValue
MetricValue' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> MetricValue

-- | The actual number that represents the metric.
[$sel:amount:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Text

-- | The unit that the metric is given in.
[$sel:unit:MetricValue'] :: MetricValue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricValue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:amount:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_amount</a> - The
--   actual number that represents the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:MetricValue'</a>, <a>metricValue_unit</a> - The unit that
--   the metric is given in.
newMetricValue :: MetricValue

-- | The actual number that represents the metric.
metricValue_amount :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Text)

-- | The unit that the metric is given in.
metricValue_unit :: Lens' MetricValue (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.MetricValue.MetricValue

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group

-- | One level of grouped data in the results.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroup</a> smart constructor.
data Group
Group' :: Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue) -> Maybe [Text] -> Group

-- | The metrics that are included in this group.
[$sel:metrics:Group'] :: Group -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue)

-- | The keys that are included in this group.
[$sel:keys:Group'] :: Group -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Group</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Group'</a>, <a>group_metrics</a> - The metrics that
--   are included in this group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keys:Group'</a>, <a>group_keys</a> - The keys that are
--   included in this group.
newGroup :: Group

-- | The metrics that are included in this group.
group_metrics :: Lens' Group (Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue))

-- | The keys that are included in this group.
group_keys :: Lens' Group (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Group.Group

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization

-- | The network field that contains a list of network metrics that are
--   associated with the current instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNetworkResourceUtilization</a> smart constructor.
data NetworkResourceUtilization
NetworkResourceUtilization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NetworkResourceUtilization

-- | The network outgress packets that are measured in packets per second.
[$sel:networkPacketsOutPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'] :: NetworkResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The network inbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per
--   second.
[$sel:networkInBytesPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'] :: NetworkResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The network ingress packets that are measured in packets per second.
[$sel:networkPacketsInPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'] :: NetworkResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The network outbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per
--   second.
[$sel:networkOutBytesPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'] :: NetworkResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NetworkResourceUtilization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkPacketsOutPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>networkResourceUtilization_networkPacketsOutPerSecond</a> - The
--   network outgress packets that are measured in packets per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkInBytesPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>networkResourceUtilization_networkInBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   network inbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkPacketsInPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>networkResourceUtilization_networkPacketsInPerSecond</a> - The
--   network ingress packets that are measured in packets per second.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkOutBytesPerSecond:NetworkResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>networkResourceUtilization_networkOutBytesPerSecond</a> - The
--   network outbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per second.
newNetworkResourceUtilization :: NetworkResourceUtilization

-- | The network outgress packets that are measured in packets per second.
networkResourceUtilization_networkPacketsOutPerSecond :: Lens' NetworkResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The network inbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per
--   second.
networkResourceUtilization_networkInBytesPerSecond :: Lens' NetworkResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The network ingress packets that are measured in packets per second.
networkResourceUtilization_networkPacketsInPerSecond :: Lens' NetworkResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The network outbound throughput utilization measured in Bytes per
--   second.
networkResourceUtilization_networkOutBytesPerSecond :: Lens' NetworkResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.NetworkResourceUtilization.NetworkResourceUtilization


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization

-- | Utilization metrics of the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEC2ResourceUtilization</a> smart constructor.
data EC2ResourceUtilization
EC2ResourceUtilization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NetworkResourceUtilization -> Maybe EBSResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DiskResourceUtilization -> EC2ResourceUtilization

-- | The maximum observed or expected CPU utilization of the instance.
[$sel:maxCpuUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The network field that contains a list of network metrics that are
--   associated with the current instance.
[$sel:networkResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe NetworkResourceUtilization

-- | The EBS field that contains a list of EBS metrics that are associated
--   with the current instance.
[$sel:eBSResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe EBSResourceUtilization

-- | The maximum observed or expected storage utilization of the instance.
--   This doesn't include EBS storage.
[$sel:maxStorageUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum observed or expected memory utilization of the instance.
[$sel:maxMemoryUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The field that contains a list of disk (local storage) metrics that
--   are associated with the current instance.
[$sel:diskResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'] :: EC2ResourceUtilization -> Maybe DiskResourceUtilization

-- | Create a value of <a>EC2ResourceUtilization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxCpuUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_maxCpuUtilizationPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum observed or expected CPU utilization of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:networkResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_networkResourceUtilization</a> - The network
--   field that contains a list of network metrics that are associated with
--   the current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eBSResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_eBSResourceUtilization</a> - The EBS field
--   that contains a list of EBS metrics that are associated with the
--   current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxStorageUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_maxStorageUtilizationPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum observed or expected storage utilization of the instance. This
--   doesn't include EBS storage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxMemoryUtilizationPercentage:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_maxMemoryUtilizationPercentage</a> - The
--   maximum observed or expected memory utilization of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskResourceUtilization:EC2ResourceUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>eC2ResourceUtilization_diskResourceUtilization</a> - The field that
--   contains a list of disk (local storage) metrics that are associated
--   with the current instance.
newEC2ResourceUtilization :: EC2ResourceUtilization

-- | The maximum observed or expected CPU utilization of the instance.
eC2ResourceUtilization_maxCpuUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The network field that contains a list of network metrics that are
--   associated with the current instance.
eC2ResourceUtilization_networkResourceUtilization :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe NetworkResourceUtilization)

-- | The EBS field that contains a list of EBS metrics that are associated
--   with the current instance.
eC2ResourceUtilization_eBSResourceUtilization :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe EBSResourceUtilization)

-- | The maximum observed or expected storage utilization of the instance.
--   This doesn't include EBS storage.
eC2ResourceUtilization_maxStorageUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum observed or expected memory utilization of the instance.
eC2ResourceUtilization_maxMemoryUtilizationPercentage :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The field that contains a list of disk (local storage) metrics that
--   are associated with the current instance.
eC2ResourceUtilization_diskResourceUtilization :: Lens' EC2ResourceUtilization (Maybe DiskResourceUtilization)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.EC2ResourceUtilization.EC2ResourceUtilization

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RDSInstanceDetails

-- | Details about the Amazon RDS instances that Amazon Web Services
--   recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRDSInstanceDetails</a> smart constructor.
data RDSInstanceDetails
RDSInstanceDetails' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RDSInstanceDetails

-- | Determines whether the recommendation is for a current-generation
--   instance.
[$sel:currentGeneration:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | Determines whether the recommendation is for a reservation in a single
--   Availability Zone or a reservation with a backup in a second
--   Availability Zone.
[$sel:deploymentOption:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance family of the recommended reservation.
[$sel:family:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
[$sel:instanceType:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The license model that the recommended reservation supports.
[$sel:licenseModel:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.
[$sel:sizeFlexEligible:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.
[$sel:region:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The database engine that the recommended reservation supports.
[$sel:databaseEngine:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The database edition that the recommended reservation supports.
[$sel:databaseEdition:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RDSInstanceDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentGeneration:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_currentGeneration</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommendation is for a current-generation instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentOption:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_deploymentOption</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommendation is for a reservation in a single Availability Zone or a
--   reservation with a backup in a second Availability Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:family:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_family</a> - The instance family of the
--   recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_instanceType</a> - The type of instance that
--   Amazon Web Services recommends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseModel:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_licenseModel</a> - The license model that the
--   recommended reservation supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeFlexEligible:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_sizeFlexEligible</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommended reservation is size flexible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_region</a> - The Amazon Web Services Region of
--   the recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseEngine:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEngine</a> - The database engine that
--   the recommended reservation supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseEdition:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEdition</a> - The database edition that
--   the recommended reservation supports.
newRDSInstanceDetails :: RDSInstanceDetails

--   instance.

--   Availability Zone or a reservation with a backup in a second
--   Availability Zone.
rDSInstanceDetails_deploymentOption :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

rDSInstanceDetails_family :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
rDSInstanceDetails_instanceType :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The license model that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_licenseModel :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.
rDSInstanceDetails_sizeFlexEligible :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.
rDSInstanceDetails_region :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The database engine that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEngine :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The database edition that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEdition :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails

-- | Details about the instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceDetails</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceDetails
InstanceDetails' :: Maybe ESInstanceDetails -> Maybe RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe ElastiCacheInstanceDetails -> Maybe EC2InstanceDetails -> Maybe RedshiftInstanceDetails -> InstanceDetails

-- | The Amazon ES instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
[$sel:eSInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'] :: InstanceDetails -> Maybe ESInstanceDetails

-- | The Amazon RDS instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
[$sel:rDSInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'] :: InstanceDetails -> Maybe RDSInstanceDetails

-- | The ElastiCache instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
[$sel:elastiCacheInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'] :: InstanceDetails -> Maybe ElastiCacheInstanceDetails

-- | The Amazon EC2 instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
[$sel:eC2InstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'] :: InstanceDetails -> Maybe EC2InstanceDetails

-- | The Amazon Redshift instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
[$sel:redshiftInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'] :: InstanceDetails -> Maybe RedshiftInstanceDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eSInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>instanceDetails_eSInstanceDetails</a> - The Amazon ES instances
--   that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rDSInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>instanceDetails_rDSInstanceDetails</a> - The Amazon RDS instances
--   that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elastiCacheInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>instanceDetails_elastiCacheInstanceDetails</a> - The ElastiCache
--   instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eC2InstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>instanceDetails_eC2InstanceDetails</a> - The Amazon EC2 instances
--   that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redshiftInstanceDetails:InstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>instanceDetails_redshiftInstanceDetails</a> - The Amazon Redshift
--   instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
newInstanceDetails :: InstanceDetails

-- | The Amazon ES instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
instanceDetails_eSInstanceDetails :: Lens' InstanceDetails (Maybe ESInstanceDetails)

-- | The Amazon RDS instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
instanceDetails_rDSInstanceDetails :: Lens' InstanceDetails (Maybe RDSInstanceDetails)

-- | The ElastiCache instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
instanceDetails_elastiCacheInstanceDetails :: Lens' InstanceDetails (Maybe ElastiCacheInstanceDetails)

-- | The Amazon EC2 instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
instanceDetails_eC2InstanceDetails :: Lens' InstanceDetails (Maybe EC2InstanceDetails)

-- | The Amazon Redshift instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
instanceDetails_redshiftInstanceDetails :: Lens' InstanceDetails (Maybe RedshiftInstanceDetails)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.InstanceDetails.InstanceDetails


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ReservationAggregates

-- | The aggregated numbers for your reservation usage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationAggregates</a> smart constructor.
data ReservationAggregates
ReservationAggregates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReservationAggregates

-- | How many reservation hours that you purchased.
[$sel:purchasedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of reservation hours that you used.
[$sel:totalActualHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of reservation time that you used.
[$sel:utilizationPercentage:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:totalAmortizedFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you didn't use. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:unusedUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The unrealized savings because of purchasing and using a reservation.
[$sel:unrealizedSavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cost of unused hours for your reservation.
[$sel:rICostForUnusedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of reservation hours that you didn't use.
[$sel:unusedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The realized savings because of purchasing and using a reservation.
[$sel:realizedSavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you purchased. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:purchasedUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The upfront cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:amortizedUpfrontFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:amortizedRecurringFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of Amazon EC2 reservation time that you used. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:utilizationPercentageInUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much you saved due to purchasing and utilizing reservation. Amazon
--   Web Services calculates this by subtracting <tt>TotalAmortizedFee</tt>
--   from <tt>OnDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed</tt>.
[$sel:netRISavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much your reservation costs if charged On-Demand rates.
[$sel:onDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much you might save if you use your entire reservation.
[$sel:totalPotentialRISavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you used. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:totalActualUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservationAggregates</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail

-- | Details about your recommended reservation purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail
ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail

-- | The maximum number of normalized units that you used in an hour during
--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:maximumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much purchasing this instance costs you on a monthly basis.
[$sel:recurringStandardMonthlyCost:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The average number of normalized units that you used in an hour during
--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:averageNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
[$sel:currencyCode:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much Amazon Web Services estimates that this specific
--   recommendation could save you in a month, as a percentage of your
--   overall costs.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavingsPercentage:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of normalized units that Amazon Web Services recommends
--   that you purchase.
[$sel:recommendedNormalizedUnitsToPurchase:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The average utilization of your instances. Amazon Web Services uses
--   this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:averageUtilization:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The account that this RI recommendation is for.
[$sel:accountId:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much Amazon Web Services estimates that this specific
--   recommendation could save you in a month.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavingsAmount:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much purchasing this instance costs you upfront.
[$sel:upfrontCost:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum number of normalized units that you used in an hour during
--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:minimumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much Amazon Web Services estimates that you spend on On-Demand
--   Instances in a month.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlyOnDemandCost:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
[$sel:recommendedNumberOfInstancesToPurchase:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:maximumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How much Amazon Web Services estimates that you would have spent for
--   all usage during the specified historical period if you had a
--   reservation.
[$sel:estimatedReservationCostForLookbackPeriod:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Details about the instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
[$sel:instanceDetails:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe InstanceDetails

-- | The average number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:averageNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
[$sel:minimumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | How long Amazon Web Services estimates that it takes for this instance
--   to start saving you money, in months.
[$sel:estimatedBreakEvenInMonths:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_recommendedNumberOfInstancesToPurchase</a>
--   - The number of instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_maximumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour</a>
--   - The maximum number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedReservationCostForLookbackPeriod:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedReservationCostForLookbackPeriod</a>
--   - How much Amazon Web Services estimates that you would have spent for
--   all usage during the specified historical period if you had a
--   reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceDetails:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_instanceDetails</a> -
--   Details about the instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:averageNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_averageNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour</a>
--   - The average number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_minimumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour</a>
--   - The minimum number of instances that you used in an hour during the
--   historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedBreakEvenInMonths:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedBreakEvenInMonths</a>
--   - How long Amazon Web Services estimates that it takes for this
--   instance to start saving you money, in months.
newReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail

-- | The maximum number of normalized units that you used in an hour during
--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.

--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ResultByTime

-- | The result that's associated with a time period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultByTime</a> smart constructor.
data ResultByTime

-- | The total amount of cost or usage accrued during the time period.
[$sel:total:ResultByTime'] :: ResultByTime -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue)

[$sel:estimated:ResultByTime'] :: ResultByTime -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultByTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   groups that this time period includes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:ResultByTime'</a>, <a>resultByTime_timePeriod</a> -
--   The time period that the result covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:ResultByTime'</a>, <a>resultByTime_total</a> - The total
--   amount of cost or usage accrued during the time period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimated:ResultByTime'</a>, <a>resultByTime_estimated</a> -
--   Determines whether the result is estimated.
newResultByTime :: ResultByTime

-- | The groups that this time period includes.

-- | The time period that the result covers.
resultByTime_timePeriod :: Lens' ResultByTime (Maybe DateInterval)
