module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues

-- | The values that are available for a tag.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> aren't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all tags. That is,
--   it's filtered on resources with no tags.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the tag
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it's filtered on resources without the
--   given tag key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagValues</a> smart constructor.
data TagValues
TagValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> TagValues

-- | The specific value of the tag.
[$sel:values:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The key for the tag.
[$sel:key:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
[$sel:matchOptions:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe [MatchOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagValues</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_values</a> - The specific
--   value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_key</a> - The key for the
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_matchOptions</a> -
--   The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newTagValues :: TagValues

-- | The specific value of the tag.
tagValues_values :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | The key for the tag.
tagValues_key :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
tagValues_matchOptions :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe [MatchOption])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TagValues.TagValues


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression

-- | Use <tt>Expression</tt> to filter by cost or by usage. There are two
--   patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Simple dimension values - You can set the dimension name and
--   values for the filters that you plan to use. For example, you can
--   filter for <tt>REGION==us-east-1 OR REGION==us-west-1</tt>. For
--   <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt>, the Region is a full name (for
--   example, <tt>REGION==US East (N. Virginia)</tt>. The
--   <tt>Expression</tt> example is as follows:<pre>{ "Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", “us-west-1” ] } }</pre>The
--   list of dimension values are OR'd together to retrieve cost or usage
--   data. You can create <tt>Expression</tt> and <tt>DimensionValues</tt>
--   objects using either <tt>with*</tt> methods or <tt>set*</tt> methods
--   in multiple lines.</li>
--   <li>Compound dimension values with logical operations - You can use
--   multiple <tt>Expression</tt> types and the logical operators
--   <tt>AND/OR/NOT</tt> to create a list of one or more
--   <tt>Expression</tt> objects. By doing this, you can filter on more
--   advanced options. For example, you can filter on <tt>((REGION ==
--   us-east-1 OR REGION == us-west-1) OR (TAG.Type == Type1)) AND
--   (USAGE_TYPE != DataTransfer)</tt>. The <tt>Expression</tt> for that is
--   as follows:<pre>{ "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION",
--   "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key":
--   "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] }</pre>Because
--   each <tt>Expression</tt> can have only one operator, the service
--   returns an error if more than one is specified. The following example
--   shows an <tt>Expression</tt> object that creates an error.<pre> {
--   "And": [ ... ], "DimensionValues": { "Dimension": "USAGE_TYPE",
--   "Values": [ "DataTransfer" ] } }</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For the <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> action, a combination of
--   OR and NOT isn't supported. OR isn't supported between different
--   dimensions, or dimensions and tags. NOT operators aren't supported.
--   Dimensions are also limited to <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>REGION</tt>, or <tt>RIGHTSIZING_TYPE</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation</tt> action, only NOT
--   is supported. AND and OR aren't supported. Dimensions are limited to
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpression</a> smart constructor.
data Expression
Expression' :: Maybe Expression -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe CostCategoryValues -> Maybe DimensionValues -> Maybe TagValues -> Expression

-- | Return results that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
[$sel:not:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe Expression

-- | Return results that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
[$sel:and:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe [Expression]

-- | Return results that match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
[$sel:or:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe [Expression]

-- | The filter that's based on <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
[$sel:costCategories:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe CostCategoryValues

-- | The specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
[$sel:dimensions:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe DimensionValues

-- | The specific <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
[$sel:tags:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe TagValues

-- | Create a value of <a>Expression</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:not:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_not</a> - Return results
--   that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_and</a> - Return results
--   that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:or:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_or</a> - Return results that
--   match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategories:Expression'</a>,
--   <a>expression_costCategories</a> - The filter that's based on
--   <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_dimensions</a> - The
--   specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_tags</a> - The specific
--   <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
newExpression :: Expression

-- | Return results that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
expression_not :: Lens' Expression (Maybe Expression)

-- | Return results that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
expression_and :: Lens' Expression (Maybe [Expression])

-- | Return results that match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
expression_or :: Lens' Expression (Maybe [Expression])

-- | The filter that's based on <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
expression_costCategories :: Lens' Expression (Maybe CostCategoryValues)

-- | The specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
expression_dimensions :: Lens' Expression (Maybe DimensionValues)

-- | The specific <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
expression_tags :: Lens' Expression (Maybe TagValues)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.Expression.Expression


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule

-- | Rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match
--   the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that
--   Cost Category value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryRule
CostCategoryRule' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe CostCategoryRuleType -> CostCategoryRule

-- | The value the line item is categorized as if the line item contains
--   the matched dimension.
[$sel:inheritedValue:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
[$sel:value:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe Text

-- | An <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
[$sel:rule:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe Expression

-- | You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
[$sel:type':CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe CostCategoryRuleType

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inheritedValue:CostCategoryRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryRule_inheritedValue</a> - The value the line item is
--   categorized as if the line item contains the matched dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_value</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rule:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_rule</a> - An
--   <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_type</a> -
--   You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
newCostCategoryRule :: CostCategoryRule

-- | The value the line item is categorized as if the line item contains
--   the matched dimension.
costCategoryRule_inheritedValue :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension)

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategoryRule_value :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
costCategoryRule_rule :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Expression)

-- | You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
costCategoryRule_type :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe CostCategoryRuleType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategoryRule.CostCategoryRule


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory

-- | The structure of Cost Categories. This includes detailed metadata and
--   the set of rules for the <tt>CostCategory</tt> object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategory</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategory
CostCategory' :: Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
[$sel:processingStatus:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus]

-- | The effective end data of your Cost Category.
[$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe Text

-- | The split charge rules that are used to allocate your charges between
--   your Cost Category values.
[$sel:splitChargeRules:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule)
[$sel:defaultValue:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
[$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text

-- | The effective state data of your Cost Category.
[$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text
[$sel:name:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text
[$sel:ruleVersion:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> CostCategoryRuleVersion

-- | The rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that
--   match the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine
--   that Cost Category value.
[$sel:rules:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategory</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingStatus:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_processingStatus</a> - The list of processing statuses
--   for Cost Management products for a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveEnd</a> - The effective end data of your Cost
--   Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:splitChargeRules:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_splitChargeRules</a> - The split charge rules that are
--   used to allocate your charges between your Cost Category values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_defaultValue</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_costCategoryArn</a> - The unique identifier for your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveStart</a> - The effective state data of your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_name</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleVersion:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_ruleVersion</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_rules</a> - The rules
--   are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match the
--   line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that Cost
--   Category value.
newCostCategory :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
costCategory_processingStatus :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus])

-- | The effective end data of your Cost Category.
costCategory_effectiveEnd :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe Text)

-- | The split charge rules that are used to allocate your charges between
--   your Cost Category values.
costCategory_splitChargeRules :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule))

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_defaultValue :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
costCategory_costCategoryArn :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | The effective state data of your Cost Category.
costCategory_effectiveStart :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_name :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_ruleVersion :: Lens' CostCategory CostCategoryRuleVersion

-- | The rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that
--   match the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine
--   that Cost Category value.
costCategory_rules :: Lens' CostCategory (NonEmpty CostCategoryRule)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CostCategory.CostCategory


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor

-- | This object continuously inspects your account's cost data for
--   anomalies. It's based on <tt>MonitorType</tt> and
--   <tt>MonitorSpecification</tt>. The content consists of detailed
--   metadata and the current status of the monitor object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyMonitor</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyMonitor
AnomalyMonitor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe MonitorDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | The value for evaluated dimensions.
[$sel:dimensionalValueCount:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:monitorSpecification:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Expression

-- | The dimensions to evaluate.
[$sel:monitorDimension:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe MonitorDimension

-- | The date when the monitor was created.
[$sel:creationDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the monitor was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the monitor last evaluated for anomalies.
[$sel:lastEvaluatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) value.
[$sel:monitorArn:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the monitor.
[$sel:monitorName:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Text

-- | The possible type values.
[$sel:monitorType:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> MonitorType

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyMonitor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionalValueCount:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_dimensionalValueCount</a> - The value for evaluated
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorSpecification:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorSpecification</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorDimension:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorDimension</a> - The dimensions to evaluate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_creationDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastUpdatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastEvaluatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastEvaluatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor
--   last evaluated for anomalies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorName:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorName</a> - The name of the monitor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorType:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorType</a> - The possible type values.
newAnomalyMonitor :: Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | The value for evaluated dimensions.
anomalyMonitor_dimensionalValueCount :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Undocumented member.
anomalyMonitor_monitorSpecification :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Expression)

-- | The dimensions to evaluate.
anomalyMonitor_monitorDimension :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe MonitorDimension)

-- | The date when the monitor was created.
anomalyMonitor_creationDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the monitor was last updated.
anomalyMonitor_lastUpdatedDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the monitor last evaluated for anomalies.
anomalyMonitor_lastEvaluatedDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) value.
anomalyMonitor_monitorArn :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the monitor.
anomalyMonitor_monitorName :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor Text

-- | The possible type values.
anomalyMonitor_monitorType :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor MonitorType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.AnomalyMonitor.AnomalyMonitor


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance

-- | Context about the current instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentInstance</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentInstance
CurrentInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceUtilization -> Maybe ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TagValues] -> CurrentInstance

-- | Resource ID of the current instance.
[$sel:resourceId:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
[$sel:currencyCode:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Utilization information of the current instance during the lookback
--   period.
[$sel:resourceUtilization:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe ResourceUtilization

-- | Details about the resource and utilization.
[$sel:resourceDetails:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe ResourceDetails

-- | The total number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback
--   period.
[$sel:totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
[$sel:reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's billed at
--   On-Demand rates.
[$sel:onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The current On-Demand cost of operating this instance on a monthly
--   basis.
[$sel:monthlyCost:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that you given an instance. This field shows as blank if you
--   haven't given the instance a name.
[$sel:instanceName:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   Savings Plans.
[$sel:savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Cost allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.
[$sel:tags:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe [TagValues]

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceId</a> - Resource ID of the current
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_currencyCode</a> - The currency code that Amazon
--   Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceUtilization:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceUtilization</a> - Utilization information
--   of the current instance during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDetails:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceDetails</a> - Details about the resource
--   and utilization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The total
--   number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The
--   number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The number of
--   hours during the lookback period that's billed at On-Demand rates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monthlyCost:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_monthlyCost</a> - The current On-Demand cost of
--   operating this instance on a monthly basis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceName:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_instanceName</a> - The name that you given an
--   instance. This field shows as blank if you haven't given the instance
--   a name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The
--   number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by Savings
--   Plans.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CurrentInstance'</a>, <a>currentInstance_tags</a> - Cost
--   allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.
newCurrentInstance :: CurrentInstance

-- | Resource ID of the current instance.
currentInstance_resourceId :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
currentInstance_currencyCode :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Utilization information of the current instance during the lookback
--   period.
currentInstance_resourceUtilization :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe ResourceUtilization)

-- | Details about the resource and utilization.
currentInstance_resourceDetails :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe ResourceDetails)

-- | The total number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback
--   period.
currentInstance_totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
currentInstance_reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's billed at
--   On-Demand rates.
currentInstance_onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The current On-Demand cost of operating this instance on a monthly
--   basis.
currentInstance_monthlyCost :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name that you given an instance. This field shows as blank if you
--   haven't given the instance a name.
currentInstance_instanceName :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   Savings Plans.
currentInstance_savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Cost allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.
currentInstance_tags :: Lens' CurrentInstance (Maybe [TagValues])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.CurrentInstance.CurrentInstance


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TargetInstance

-- | Details on recommended instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetInstance</a> smart constructor.
data TargetInstance
TargetInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceDetails -> Maybe [PlatformDifference] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceUtilization -> TargetInstance

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
[$sel:currencyCode:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Details on the target instance type.
[$sel:resourceDetails:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe ResourceDetails

-- | Explains the actions you might need to take in order to successfully
--   migrate your workloads from the current instance type to the
--   recommended instance type.
[$sel:platformDifferences:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe [PlatformDifference]

-- | Determines whether this recommendation is the defaulted Amazon Web
--   Services recommendation.
[$sel:defaultTargetInstance:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The expected cost to operate this instance type on a monthly basis.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlyCost:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated savings that result from modification, on a monthly
--   basis.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavings:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected utilization metrics for target instance type.
[$sel:expectedResourceUtilization:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe ResourceUtilization

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_currencyCode</a> - The currency code that Amazon Web
--   Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDetails:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_resourceDetails</a> - Details on the target instance
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platformDifferences:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_platformDifferences</a> - Explains the actions you
--   might need to take in order to successfully migrate your workloads
--   from the current instance type to the recommended instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTargetInstance:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_defaultTargetInstance</a> - Determines whether this
--   recommendation is the defaulted Amazon Web Services recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedMonthlyCost:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_estimatedMonthlyCost</a> - The expected cost to
--   operate this instance type on a monthly basis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedMonthlySavings:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_estimatedMonthlySavings</a> - The estimated savings
--   that result from modification, on a monthly basis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedResourceUtilization:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_expectedResourceUtilization</a> - The expected
--   utilization metrics for target instance type.
newTargetInstance :: TargetInstance

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
targetInstance_currencyCode :: Lens' TargetInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Details on the target instance type.
targetInstance_resourceDetails :: Lens' TargetInstance (Maybe ResourceDetails)

--   migrate your workloads from the current instance type to the
--   recommended instance type.

--   Services recommendation.

--   basis.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation

-- | Contains your request parameters, Savings Plan Recommendations
--   Summary, and Details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation
SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation' :: Maybe [SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail] -> Maybe TermInYears -> Maybe AccountScope -> Maybe SupportedSavingsPlansType -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays -> Maybe PaymentOption -> Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation

-- | Details for the Savings Plans we recommend that you purchase to cover
--   existing Savings Plans eligible workloads.
[$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetails:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe [SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail]

-- | The Savings Plans recommendation term in years. It's used to generate
--   the recommendation.
[$sel:termInYears:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe TermInYears

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations that include the management
--   account and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If
--   the value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for
--   individual member accounts only.
[$sel:accountScope:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

-- | The requested Savings Plans recommendation type.
[$sel:savingsPlansType:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe SupportedSavingsPlansType

-- | The lookback period in days, used to generate the recommendation.
[$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The payment option used to generate the recommendation.
[$sel:paymentOption:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe PaymentOption

-- | Summary metrics for your Savings Plans Recommendations.
[$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetails</a>
--   - Details for the Savings Plans we recommend that you purchase to
--   cover existing Savings Plans eligible workloads.
--   
--   <a>$sel:termInYears:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears</a> - The Savings
--   Plans recommendation term in years. It's used to generate the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountScope:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope</a> - The account
--   scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web Services
--   calculates recommendations that include the management account and
--   member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the value is
--   <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for individual member
--   accounts only.

--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansType:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansType</a> - The

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ReservationPurchaseRecommendation

-- | A specific reservation that Amazon Web Services recommends for
--   purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationPurchaseRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReservationPurchaseRecommendation
ReservationPurchaseRecommendation' :: Maybe TermInYears -> Maybe ReservationPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe ServiceSpecification -> Maybe AccountScope -> Maybe [ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail] -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays -> Maybe PaymentOption -> ReservationPurchaseRecommendation

-- | The term of the reservation that you want recommendations for, in
--   years.
[$sel:termInYears:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe TermInYears

-- | A summary about the recommended purchase.
[$sel:recommendationSummary:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe ReservationPurchaseRecommendationSummary

-- | Hardware specifications for the service that you want recommendations
--   for.
[$sel:serviceSpecification:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe ServiceSpecification

-- | The account scope that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase this instance for. For example, you can purchase this
--   reservation for an entire organization in Amazon Web Services
--   Organizations.
[$sel:accountScope:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

-- | Details about the recommended purchases.
[$sel:recommendationDetails:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe [ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail]

-- | How many days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services considers
--   when making this recommendation.
[$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The payment option for the reservation (for example,
--   <tt>AllUpfront</tt> or <tt>NoUpfront</tt>).
[$sel:paymentOption:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe PaymentOption

-- | Create a value of <a>ReservationPurchaseRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:termInYears:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears</a> - The term of the
--   reservation that you want recommendations for, in years.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationSummary:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_recommendationSummary</a> - A
--   summary about the recommended purchase.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceSpecification:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_serviceSpecification</a> -
--   Hardware specifications for the service that you want recommendations
--   for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountScope:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope</a> - The account
--   scope that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase this
--   instance for. For example, you can purchase this reservation for an
--   entire organization in Amazon Web Services Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationDetails:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_recommendationDetails</a> -
--   Details about the recommended purchases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays</a> - How
--   many days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services considers when
--   making this recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:paymentOption:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendation_paymentOption</a> - The payment
--   option for the reservation (for example, <tt>AllUpfront</tt> or
--   <tt>NoUpfront</tt>).
newReservationPurchaseRecommendation :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation

-- | The term of the reservation that you want recommendations for, in
--   years.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe TermInYears)

-- | A summary about the recommended purchase.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_recommendationSummary :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe ReservationPurchaseRecommendationSummary)

-- | Hardware specifications for the service that you want recommendations
--   for.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_serviceSpecification :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe ServiceSpecification)

-- | The account scope that Amazon Web Services recommends that you
--   purchase this instance for. For example, you can purchase this
--   reservation for an entire organization in Amazon Web Services
--   Organizations.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe AccountScope)

-- | Details about the recommended purchases.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_recommendationDetails :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe [ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail])

-- | How many days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services considers
--   when making this recommendation.
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays)

-- | The payment option for the reservation (for example,
--   <tt>AllUpfront</tt> or <tt>NoUpfront</tt>).
reservationPurchaseRecommendation_paymentOption :: Lens' ReservationPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe PaymentOption)

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.ReservationPurchaseRecommendation.ReservationPurchaseRecommendation

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation

-- | Recommendations to rightsize resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRightsizingRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data RightsizingRecommendation
RightsizingRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [FindingReasonCode] -> Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail -> Maybe CurrentInstance -> Maybe RightsizingType -> Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail -> RightsizingRecommendation

-- | The account that this recommendation is for.
[$sel:accountId:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such
--   as under or over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU,
--   Memory, Network).
[$sel:findingReasonCodes:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe [FindingReasonCode]

-- | The details for the modification recommendations.
[$sel:modifyRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail

-- | Context regarding the current instance.
[$sel:currentInstance:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe CurrentInstance

-- | A recommendation to either terminate or modify the resource.
[$sel:rightsizingType:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe RightsizingType

-- | The details for termination recommendations.
[$sel:terminateRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>RightsizingRecommendation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_accountId</a> - The account that this
--   recommendation is for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingReasonCodes:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_findingReasonCodes</a> - The list of
--   possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such as under or
--   over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU, Memory,
--   Network).
--   
--   <a>$sel:modifyRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_modifyRecommendationDetail</a> - The
--   details for the modification recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentInstance:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_currentInstance</a> - Context regarding
--   the current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rightsizingType:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_rightsizingType</a> - A recommendation to
--   either terminate or modify the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminateRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_terminateRecommendationDetail</a> - The
--   details for termination recommendations.
newRightsizingRecommendation :: RightsizingRecommendation

-- | The account that this recommendation is for.
rightsizingRecommendation_accountId :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such
--   as under or over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU,
--   Memory, Network).
rightsizingRecommendation_findingReasonCodes :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe [FindingReasonCode])

-- | The details for the modification recommendations.
rightsizingRecommendation_modifyRecommendationDetail :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail)

-- | Context regarding the current instance.
rightsizingRecommendation_currentInstance :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe CurrentInstance)

-- | A recommendation to either terminate or modify the resource.
rightsizingRecommendation_rightsizingType :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe RightsizingType)

-- | The details for termination recommendations.
rightsizingRecommendation_terminateRecommendationDetail :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.RightsizingRecommendation.RightsizingRecommendation


module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.TotalImpactFilter

-- | Filters cost anomalies based on the total impact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTotalImpactFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TotalImpactFilter
TotalImpactFilter' :: Maybe Double -> NumericOperator -> Double -> TotalImpactFilter

-- | The upper bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:endValue:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> Maybe Double

-- | The comparing value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:numericOperator:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> NumericOperator

-- | The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:startValue:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>TotalImpactFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endValue:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_endValue</a> - The upper bound dollar value
--   that's used in the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numericOperator:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_numericOperator</a> - The comparing value that's
--   used in the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startValue:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_startValue</a> - The lower bound dollar value
--   that's used in the filter.

-- | The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.UtilizationByTime

-- | The amount of utilization, in hours.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUtilizationByTime</a> smart constructor.
data UtilizationByTime
UtilizationByTime' :: Maybe [ReservationUtilizationGroup] -> Maybe DateInterval -> Maybe ReservationAggregates -> UtilizationByTime

-- | The groups that this utilization result uses.
[$sel:groups:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe [ReservationUtilizationGroup]

-- | The period of time that this utilization was used for.
[$sel:timePeriod:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe DateInterval

-- | The total number of reservation hours that were used.
[$sel:total:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe ReservationAggregates

-- | Create a value of <a>UtilizationByTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groups:UtilizationByTime'</a>, <a>utilizationByTime_groups</a>
--   - The groups that this utilization result uses.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:UtilizationByTime'</a>,
--   <a>utilizationByTime_timePeriod</a> - The period of time that this
--   utilization was used for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:UtilizationByTime'</a>, <a>utilizationByTime_total</a> -
--   The total number of reservation hours that were used.
newUtilizationByTime :: UtilizationByTime

-- | The groups that this utilization result uses.
utilizationByTime_groups :: Lens' UtilizationByTime (Maybe [ReservationUtilizationGroup])

-- | The period of time that this utilization was used for.
utilizationByTime_timePeriod :: Lens' UtilizationByTime (Maybe DateInterval)

-- | The total number of reservation hours that were used.
utilizationByTime_total :: Lens' UtilizationByTime (Maybe ReservationAggregates)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types.UtilizationByTime.UtilizationByTime

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Types

-- | API version <tt>2017-10-25</tt> of the Amazon Cost Explorer Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The cost anomaly subscription does not exist for the account.
_UnknownSubscriptionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested report expired. Update the date interval and try again.
_BillExpirationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request parameters changed between pages. Try again with the old
--   parameters or without a pagination token.
_RequestChangedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Cost Explorer was unable to identify the usage unit. Provide
--   <tt>UsageType/UsageTypeGroup</tt> filter selections that contain
--   matching units, for example: <tt>hours</tt>.
_UnresolvableUsageUnitException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit on the number of resources you can create, or
--   exceeded the size of an individual resource.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The pagination token is invalid. Try again without a pagination token.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested data is unavailable.
_DataUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cost anomaly monitor does not exist for the account.
_UnknownMonitorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified ARN in the request doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You made too many calls in a short period of time. Try again later.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An unusual cost pattern. This consists of the detailed metadata and
--   the current status of the anomaly object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomaly</a> smart constructor.
data Anomaly
Anomaly' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RootCause] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType -> Text -> AnomalyScore -> Impact -> Text -> Anomaly

-- | The first day the anomaly is detected.
[$sel:anomalyStartDate:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Maybe Text

-- | The dimension for the anomaly (for example, an Amazon Web Services
--   service in a service monitor).
[$sel:dimensionValue:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of identified root causes for the anomaly.
[$sel:rootCauses:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Maybe [RootCause]

-- | The last day the anomaly is detected.
[$sel:anomalyEndDate:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Maybe Text

-- | The feedback value.
[$sel:feedback:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType

-- | The unique identifier for the anomaly.
[$sel:anomalyId:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Text

-- | The latest and maximum score for the anomaly.
[$sel:anomalyScore:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> AnomalyScore

-- | The dollar impact for the anomaly.
[$sel:impact:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Impact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cost monitor that generated
--   this anomaly.
[$sel:monitorArn:Anomaly'] :: Anomaly -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Anomaly</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyStartDate:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyStartDate</a>
--   - The first day the anomaly is detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValue:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_dimensionValue</a> -
--   The dimension for the anomaly (for example, an Amazon Web Services
--   service in a service monitor).
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootCauses:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_rootCauses</a> - The list
--   of identified root causes for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyEndDate:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyEndDate</a> -
--   The last day the anomaly is detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedback:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_feedback</a> - The feedback
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyId:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyScore:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyScore</a> - The
--   latest and maximum score for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_impact</a> - The dollar impact
--   for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_monitorArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cost monitor that generated this
--   anomaly.
newAnomaly :: Text -> AnomalyScore -> Impact -> Text -> Anomaly

-- | The first day the anomaly is detected.
anomaly_anomalyStartDate :: Lens' Anomaly (Maybe Text)

-- | The dimension for the anomaly (for example, an Amazon Web Services
--   service in a service monitor).
anomaly_dimensionValue :: Lens' Anomaly (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of identified root causes for the anomaly.
anomaly_rootCauses :: Lens' Anomaly (Maybe [RootCause])

-- | The last day the anomaly is detected.
anomaly_anomalyEndDate :: Lens' Anomaly (Maybe Text)

-- | The feedback value.
anomaly_feedback :: Lens' Anomaly (Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType)

-- | The unique identifier for the anomaly.
anomaly_anomalyId :: Lens' Anomaly Text

-- | The latest and maximum score for the anomaly.
anomaly_anomalyScore :: Lens' Anomaly AnomalyScore

-- | The dollar impact for the anomaly.
anomaly_impact :: Lens' Anomaly Impact

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cost monitor that generated
--   this anomaly.
anomaly_monitorArn :: Lens' Anomaly Text

-- | The time period for an anomaly.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyDateInterval</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyDateInterval
AnomalyDateInterval' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> AnomalyDateInterval

-- | The last date an anomaly was observed.
[$sel:endDate:AnomalyDateInterval'] :: AnomalyDateInterval -> Maybe Text

-- | The first date an anomaly was observed.
[$sel:startDate:AnomalyDateInterval'] :: AnomalyDateInterval -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyDateInterval</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:AnomalyDateInterval'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyDateInterval_endDate</a> - The last date an anomaly was
--   observed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:AnomalyDateInterval'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyDateInterval_startDate</a> - The first date an anomaly was
--   observed.
newAnomalyDateInterval :: Text -> AnomalyDateInterval

-- | The last date an anomaly was observed.
anomalyDateInterval_endDate :: Lens' AnomalyDateInterval (Maybe Text)

-- | The first date an anomaly was observed.
anomalyDateInterval_startDate :: Lens' AnomalyDateInterval Text

-- | This object continuously inspects your account's cost data for
--   anomalies. It's based on <tt>MonitorType</tt> and
--   <tt>MonitorSpecification</tt>. The content consists of detailed
--   metadata and the current status of the monitor object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyMonitor</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyMonitor
AnomalyMonitor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe MonitorDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | The value for evaluated dimensions.
[$sel:dimensionalValueCount:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:monitorSpecification:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Expression

-- | The dimensions to evaluate.
[$sel:monitorDimension:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe MonitorDimension

-- | The date when the monitor was created.
[$sel:creationDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the monitor was last updated.
[$sel:lastUpdatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the monitor last evaluated for anomalies.
[$sel:lastEvaluatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) value.
[$sel:monitorArn:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the monitor.
[$sel:monitorName:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> Text

-- | The possible type values.
[$sel:monitorType:AnomalyMonitor'] :: AnomalyMonitor -> MonitorType

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyMonitor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionalValueCount:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_dimensionalValueCount</a> - The value for evaluated
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorSpecification:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorSpecification</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorDimension:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorDimension</a> - The dimensions to evaluate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_creationDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastUpdatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastEvaluatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastEvaluatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor
--   last evaluated for anomalies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorName:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorName</a> - The name of the monitor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorType:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorType</a> - The possible type values.
newAnomalyMonitor :: Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | The value for evaluated dimensions.
anomalyMonitor_dimensionalValueCount :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Natural)

-- | Undocumented member.
anomalyMonitor_monitorSpecification :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Expression)

-- | The dimensions to evaluate.
anomalyMonitor_monitorDimension :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe MonitorDimension)

-- | The date when the monitor was created.
anomalyMonitor_creationDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the monitor was last updated.
anomalyMonitor_lastUpdatedDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the monitor last evaluated for anomalies.
anomalyMonitor_lastEvaluatedDate :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) value.
anomalyMonitor_monitorArn :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the monitor.
anomalyMonitor_monitorName :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor Text

-- | The possible type values.
anomalyMonitor_monitorType :: Lens' AnomalyMonitor MonitorType

-- | Quantifies the anomaly. The higher score means that it's more
--   anomalous.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyScore</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyScore
AnomalyScore' :: Double -> Double -> AnomalyScore

-- | The maximum score that's observed during the
--   <tt>AnomalyDateInterval</tt>.
[$sel:maxScore:AnomalyScore'] :: AnomalyScore -> Double

-- | The last observed score.
[$sel:currentScore:AnomalyScore'] :: AnomalyScore -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyScore</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxScore:AnomalyScore'</a>, <a>anomalyScore_maxScore</a> - The
--   maximum score that's observed during the <tt>AnomalyDateInterval</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentScore:AnomalyScore'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyScore_currentScore</a> - The last observed score.
newAnomalyScore :: Double -> Double -> AnomalyScore

-- | The maximum score that's observed during the
--   <tt>AnomalyDateInterval</tt>.
anomalyScore_maxScore :: Lens' AnomalyScore Double

-- | The last observed score.
anomalyScore_currentScore :: Lens' AnomalyScore Double

-- | The association between a monitor, threshold, and list of subscribers
--   used to deliver notifications about anomalies detected by a monitor
--   that exceeds a threshold. The content consists of the detailed
--   metadata and the current status of the <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt>
--   object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalySubscription</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalySubscription
AnomalySubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> [Text] -> [Subscriber] -> Double -> AnomalySubscriptionFrequency -> Text -> AnomalySubscription

-- | Your unique account identifier.
[$sel:accountId:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt> Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
[$sel:subscriptionArn:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of cost anomaly monitors.
[$sel:monitorArnList:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> [Text]

-- | A list of subscribers to notify.
[$sel:subscribers:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> [Subscriber]

-- | The dollar value that triggers a notification if the threshold is
--   exceeded.
[$sel:threshold:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> Double

-- | The frequency that anomaly reports are sent over email.
[$sel:frequency:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> AnomalySubscriptionFrequency

-- | The name for the subscription.
[$sel:subscriptionName:AnomalySubscription'] :: AnomalySubscription -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalySubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_accountId</a> - Your unique account identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionArn:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscriptionArn</a> - The
--   <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt> Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArnList:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_monitorArnList</a> - A list of cost anomaly
--   monitors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscribers:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscribers</a> - A list of subscribers to
--   notify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_threshold</a> - The dollar value that triggers
--   a notification if the threshold is exceeded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_frequency</a> - The frequency that anomaly
--   reports are sent over email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionName:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscriptionName</a> - The name for the
--   subscription.
newAnomalySubscription :: Double -> AnomalySubscriptionFrequency -> Text -> AnomalySubscription

-- | Your unique account identifier.
anomalySubscription_accountId :: Lens' AnomalySubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt> Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
anomalySubscription_subscriptionArn :: Lens' AnomalySubscription (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of cost anomaly monitors.
anomalySubscription_monitorArnList :: Lens' AnomalySubscription [Text]

-- | A list of subscribers to notify.
anomalySubscription_subscribers :: Lens' AnomalySubscription [Subscriber]

-- | The dollar value that triggers a notification if the threshold is
--   exceeded.
anomalySubscription_threshold :: Lens' AnomalySubscription Double

-- | The frequency that anomaly reports are sent over email.
anomalySubscription_frequency :: Lens' AnomalySubscription AnomalySubscriptionFrequency

-- | The name for the subscription.
anomalySubscription_subscriptionName :: Lens' AnomalySubscription Text

-- | The structure of Cost Categories. This includes detailed metadata and
--   the set of rules for the <tt>CostCategory</tt> object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategory</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategory
CostCategory' :: Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
[$sel:processingStatus:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus]

-- | The effective end data of your Cost Category.
[$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe Text

-- | The split charge rules that are used to allocate your charges between
--   your Cost Category values.
[$sel:splitChargeRules:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule)
[$sel:defaultValue:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
[$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text

-- | The effective state data of your Cost Category.
[$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text
[$sel:name:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> Text
[$sel:ruleVersion:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> CostCategoryRuleVersion

-- | The rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that
--   match the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine
--   that Cost Category value.
[$sel:rules:CostCategory'] :: CostCategory -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategory</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingStatus:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_processingStatus</a> - The list of processing statuses
--   for Cost Management products for a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveEnd</a> - The effective end data of your Cost
--   Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:splitChargeRules:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_splitChargeRules</a> - The split charge rules that are
--   used to allocate your charges between your Cost Category values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_defaultValue</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_costCategoryArn</a> - The unique identifier for your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveStart</a> - The effective state data of your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_name</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleVersion:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_ruleVersion</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_rules</a> - The rules
--   are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match the
--   line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that Cost
--   Category value.
newCostCategory :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
costCategory_processingStatus :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus])

-- | The effective end data of your Cost Category.
costCategory_effectiveEnd :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe Text)

-- | The split charge rules that are used to allocate your charges between
--   your Cost Category values.
costCategory_splitChargeRules :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule))

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_defaultValue :: Lens' CostCategory (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
costCategory_costCategoryArn :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | The effective state data of your Cost Category.
costCategory_effectiveStart :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_name :: Lens' CostCategory Text

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategory_ruleVersion :: Lens' CostCategory CostCategoryRuleVersion

-- | The rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that
--   match the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine
--   that Cost Category value.
costCategory_rules :: Lens' CostCategory (NonEmpty CostCategoryRule)

-- | When creating or updating a cost category, you can define the
--   <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. This
--   rule type adds the flexibility of defining a rule that dynamically
--   inherits the cost category value from the dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs that are based on the value of a specific
--   tag key, first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the
--   tag dimension and specify the tag key to use.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | The name of the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
[$sel:dimensionName:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'] :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName

-- | The key to extract cost category values.
[$sel:dimensionKey:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'] :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionName</a> - The name of
--   the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionKey:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionKey</a> - The key to
--   extract cost category values.
newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | The name of the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionName :: Lens' CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension (Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName)

-- | The key to extract cost category values.
costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionKey :: Lens' CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryProcessingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryProcessingStatus
CostCategoryProcessingStatus' :: Maybe CostCategoryStatus -> Maybe CostCategoryStatusComponent -> CostCategoryProcessingStatus

[$sel:status:CostCategoryProcessingStatus'] :: CostCategoryProcessingStatus -> Maybe CostCategoryStatus

--   product name of the applied status.
newCostCategoryProcessingStatus :: CostCategoryProcessingStatus
