costCategoryProcessingStatus_status :: Lens' CostCategoryProcessingStatus (Maybe CostCategoryStatus)

-- | The Cost Management product name of the applied status.
costCategoryProcessingStatus_component :: Lens' CostCategoryProcessingStatus (Maybe CostCategoryStatusComponent)

-- | A reference to a Cost Category containing only enough information to
--   identify the Cost Category.
--   
--   You can use this information to retrieve the full Cost Category
--   information using <tt>DescribeCostCategory</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryReference</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryReference
CostCategoryReference' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryReference

-- | The Cost Category's effective start date.
[$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of unique cost category values in a specific cost category.
[$sel:values:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The unique identifier for your Cost Category.
[$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
[$sel:processingStatus:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus]

-- | The number of rules that are associated with a specific Cost Category.
[$sel:numberOfRules:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Natural
[$sel:name:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | The Cost Category's effective end date.
[$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text
[$sel:defaultValue:CostCategoryReference'] :: CostCategoryReference -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryReference</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

newCostCategoryReference :: CostCategoryReference

-- | The Cost Category's effective start date.
costCategoryReference_effectiveStart :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of unique cost category values in a specific cost category.
costCategoryReference_values :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe [Text])

costCategoryReference_costCategoryArn :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe Text)

--   specific cost category.
costCategoryReference_processingStatus :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus])

-- | The number of rules that are associated with a specific Cost Category.
costCategoryReference_numberOfRules :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Cost Category's effective end date.
costCategoryReference_effectiveEnd :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategoryReference_defaultValue :: Lens' CostCategoryReference (Maybe Text)

-- | Rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match
--   the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that
--   Cost Category value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryRule
CostCategoryRule' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe CostCategoryRuleType -> CostCategoryRule

-- | The value the line item is categorized as if the line item contains
--   the matched dimension.
[$sel:inheritedValue:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
[$sel:value:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe Text

-- | An <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
[$sel:rule:CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe Expression

-- | You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
[$sel:type':CostCategoryRule'] :: CostCategoryRule -> Maybe CostCategoryRuleType

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inheritedValue:CostCategoryRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryRule_inheritedValue</a> - The value the line item is
--   categorized as if the line item contains the matched dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_value</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rule:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_rule</a> - An
--   <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_type</a> -
--   You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
newCostCategoryRule :: CostCategoryRule

-- | The value the line item is categorized as if the line item contains
--   the matched dimension.
costCategoryRule_inheritedValue :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension)

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategoryRule_value :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
costCategoryRule_rule :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Expression)

-- | You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
costCategoryRule_type :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe CostCategoryRuleType)

-- | Use the split charge rule to split the cost of one Cost Category value
--   across several other target values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategorySplitChargeRule
CostCategorySplitChargeRule' :: Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter) -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | The parameters for a split charge method. This is only required for
--   the <tt>FIXED</tt> method.
[$sel:parameters:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter)

-- | The Cost Category value that you want to split. That value can't be
--   used as a source or a target in other split charge rules. To indicate
--   uncategorized costs, you can use an empty string as the source.
[$sel:source:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> Text

-- | The Cost Category values that you want to split costs across. These
--   values can't be used as a source in other split charge rules.
[$sel:targets:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The method that's used to define how to split your source costs across
--   your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
[$sel:method:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'] :: CostCategorySplitChargeRule -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters</a> - The parameters for a
--   split charge method. This is only required for the <tt>FIXED</tt>
--   method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_source</a> - The Cost Category value
--   that you want to split. That value can't be used as a source or a
--   target in other split charge rules. To indicate uncategorized costs,
--   you can use an empty string as the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets</a> - The Cost Category values
--   that you want to split costs across. These values can't be used as a
--   source in other split charge rules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:method:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_method</a> - The method that's used to
--   define how to split your source costs across your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
newCostCategorySplitChargeRule :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | The parameters for a split charge method. This is only required for
--   the <tt>FIXED</tt> method.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter))

-- | The Cost Category value that you want to split. That value can't be
--   used as a source or a target in other split charge rules. To indicate
--   uncategorized costs, you can use an empty string as the source.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_source :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule Text

-- | The Cost Category values that you want to split costs across. These
--   values can't be used as a source in other split charge rules.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The method that's used to define how to split your source costs across
--   your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
costCategorySplitChargeRule_method :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule CostCategorySplitChargeMethod

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter_values</a> - The parameter
--   values.

-- | The Cost Categories values used for filtering the costs.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> are not specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all Cost
--   Categories. That is, it filters on resources that aren't mapped to any
--   Cost Categories.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the Cost Categories
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it filters on resources without the given
--   Cost Categories key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryValues</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryValues
CostCategoryValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> CostCategoryValues

[$sel:key:CostCategoryValues'] :: CostCategoryValues -> Maybe Text

--   The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and
--   <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryValues</a> with all optional fields

--   Undocumented member.

--   can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for
--   actions related to cost category. The default values for
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.

-- | The amount of instance usage that a reservation covered.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data Coverage
Coverage' :: Maybe CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe CoverageHours -> Maybe CoverageCost -> Coverage

--   normalized units.

coverageHours_reservedHours :: Lens' CoverageHours (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of instance usage, in normalized units. You can use
--   normalized units to see your EC2 usage for multiple sizes of instances
--   in a uniform way. For example, suppose that you run an xlarge instance
--   and a 2xlarge instance. If you run both instances for the same amount
--   of time, the 2xlarge instance uses twice as much of your reservation
--   as the xlarge instance, even though both instances show only one
--   instance-hour. When you use normalized units instead of
--   instance-hours, the xlarge instance used 8 normalized units, and the
--   2xlarge instance used 16 normalized units.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Modifying Reserved Instances</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Linux Instances</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageNormalizedUnits</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageNormalizedUnits
CoverageNormalizedUnits' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | The number of normalized units that a reservation covers.
[$sel:reservedNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of normalized units that you used.
[$sel:totalRunningNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of your used instance normalized units that a
--   reservation covers.
[$sel:coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances
--   instead of a reservation.
[$sel:onDemandNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'] :: CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CoverageNormalizedUnits</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_reservedNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that a reservation covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_totalRunningNormalizedUnits</a> - The total
--   number of normalized units that you used.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage</a> - The
--   percentage of your used instance normalized units that a reservation
--   covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_onDemandNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances instead of a
--   reservation.
newCoverageNormalizedUnits :: CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | The number of normalized units that a reservation covers.
coverageNormalizedUnits_reservedNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of normalized units that you used.
coverageNormalizedUnits_totalRunningNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of your used instance normalized units that a
--   reservation covers.
coverageNormalizedUnits_coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances
--   instead of a reservation.
coverageNormalizedUnits_onDemandNormalizedUnits :: Lens' CoverageNormalizedUnits (Maybe Text)

-- | Context about the current instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentInstance</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentInstance
CurrentInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceUtilization -> Maybe ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TagValues] -> CurrentInstance

-- | Resource ID of the current instance.
[$sel:resourceId:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
[$sel:currencyCode:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Utilization information of the current instance during the lookback
--   period.
[$sel:resourceUtilization:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe ResourceUtilization

-- | Details about the resource and utilization.
[$sel:resourceDetails:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe ResourceDetails

-- | The total number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback
--   period.
[$sel:totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
[$sel:reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's billed at
--   On-Demand rates.
[$sel:onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The current On-Demand cost of operating this instance on a monthly
--   basis.
[$sel:monthlyCost:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name that you given an instance. This field shows as blank if you
--   haven't given the instance a name.
[$sel:instanceName:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   Savings Plans.
[$sel:savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Cost allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.
[$sel:tags:CurrentInstance'] :: CurrentInstance -> Maybe [TagValues]

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceId</a> - Resource ID of the current
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_currencyCode</a> - The currency code that Amazon
--   Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceUtilization:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceUtilization</a> - Utilization information
--   of the current instance during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDetails:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceDetails</a> - Details about the resource
--   and utilization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The total
--   number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The
--   number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The number of

--   
--   <a>$sel:monthlyCost:CurrentInstance'</a>,

-- | The time period of the request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDateInterval</a> smart constructor.
data DateInterval
DateInterval' :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | The beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
[$sel:start:DateInterval'] :: DateInterval -> Text

-- | The end of the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:end:DateInterval'] :: DateInterval -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DateInterval</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_start</a> - The
--   beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_end</a> - The end of
--   the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
newDateInterval :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | The beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
dateInterval_start :: Lens' DateInterval Text

-- | The end of the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
dateInterval_end :: Lens' DateInterval Text

-- | The metadata that you can use to filter and group your results. You
--   can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensionValues</a> smart constructor.
data DimensionValues
DimensionValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Dimension -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> DimensionValues

-- | The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
[$sel:values:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group
--   your results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
[$sel:key:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe Dimension

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
[$sel:matchOptions:DimensionValues'] :: DimensionValues -> Maybe [MatchOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>DimensionValues</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:DimensionValues'</a>, <a>dimensionValues_key</a> - The
--   names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group your
--   results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:DimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionValues_matchOptions</a> - The match options that you can
--   use to filter your results. <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable
--   for actions related to Cost Category. The default values for
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newDimensionValues :: DimensionValues

-- | The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results.
--   You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to find specific values.
dimensionValues_values :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe [Text])

--   your results. For example, <tt>AZ</tt> returns a list of Availability
--   Zones.
dimensionValues_key :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe Dimension)

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.

--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
dimensionValues_matchOptions :: Lens' DimensionValues (Maybe [MatchOption])

eSInstanceDetails_region :: Lens' ESInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Use <tt>Expression</tt> to filter by cost or by usage. There are two
--   patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Simple dimension values - You can set the dimension name and
--   values for the filters that you plan to use. For example, you can
--   filter for <tt>REGION==us-east-1 OR REGION==us-west-1</tt>. For
--   <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt>, the Region is a full name (for
--   example, <tt>REGION==US East (N. Virginia)</tt>. The
--   <tt>Expression</tt> example is as follows:<pre>{ "Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", “us-west-1” ] } }</pre>The
--   list of dimension values are OR'd together to retrieve cost or usage
--   data. You can create <tt>Expression</tt> and <tt>DimensionValues</tt>
--   objects using either <tt>with*</tt> methods or <tt>set*</tt> methods
--   in multiple lines.</li>
--   <li>Compound dimension values with logical operations - You can use
--   multiple <tt>Expression</tt> types and the logical operators
--   <tt>AND/OR/NOT</tt> to create a list of one or more
--   <tt>Expression</tt> objects. By doing this, you can filter on more
--   advanced options. For example, you can filter on <tt>((REGION ==
--   us-east-1 OR REGION == us-west-1) OR (TAG.Type == Type1)) AND
--   (USAGE_TYPE != DataTransfer)</tt>. The <tt>Expression</tt> for that is
--   as follows:<pre>{ "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION",
--   "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key":
--   "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] }</pre>Because
--   each <tt>Expression</tt> can have only one operator, the service
--   returns an error if more than one is specified. The following example
--   shows an <tt>Expression</tt> object that creates an error.<pre> {
--   "And": [ ... ], "DimensionValues": { "Dimension": "USAGE_TYPE",
--   "Values": [ "DataTransfer" ] } }</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For the <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> action, a combination of
--   OR and NOT isn't supported. OR isn't supported between different
--   dimensions, or dimensions and tags. NOT operators aren't supported.
--   Dimensions are also limited to <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>REGION</tt>, or <tt>RIGHTSIZING_TYPE</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation</tt> action, only NOT
--   is supported. AND and OR aren't supported. Dimensions are limited to
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpression</a> smart constructor.
data Expression
Expression' :: Maybe Expression -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe CostCategoryValues -> Maybe DimensionValues -> Maybe TagValues -> Expression

-- | Return results that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
[$sel:not:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe Expression

-- | Return results that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
[$sel:and:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe [Expression]

-- | Return results that match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
[$sel:or:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe [Expression]

-- | The filter that's based on <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
[$sel:costCategories:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe CostCategoryValues

-- | The specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
[$sel:dimensions:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe DimensionValues

-- | The specific <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
[$sel:tags:Expression'] :: Expression -> Maybe TagValues

-- | Create a value of <a>Expression</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:not:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_not</a> - Return results
--   that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_and</a> - Return results
--   that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:or:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_or</a> - Return results that
--   match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategories:Expression'</a>,
--   <a>expression_costCategories</a> - The filter that's based on
--   <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_dimensions</a> - The
--   specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_tags</a> - The specific
--   <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
newExpression :: Expression

-- | Return results that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
expression_not :: Lens' Expression (Maybe Expression)

-- | Return results that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
expression_and :: Lens' Expression (Maybe [Expression])

-- | Return results that match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
expression_or :: Lens' Expression (Maybe [Expression])

-- | The filter that's based on <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
expression_costCategories :: Lens' Expression (Maybe CostCategoryValues)

-- | The specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
expression_dimensions :: Lens' Expression (Maybe DimensionValues)

-- | The specific <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
expression_tags :: Lens' Expression (Maybe TagValues)

-- | One level of grouped data in the results.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroup</a> smart constructor.
data Group

--   are included in this group.

--   included in this group.
newGroup :: Group

-- | The metrics that are included in this group.
group_metrics :: Lens' Group (Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue))

-- | The keys that are included in this group.
group_keys :: Lens' Group (Maybe [Text])

--   instance.

--   Availability Zone or a reservation with a backup in a second
--   Availability Zone.

[$sel:region:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

[$sel:databaseEngine:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

[$sel:databaseEdition:RDSInstanceDetails'] :: RDSInstanceDetails -> Maybe Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_currentGeneration</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommendation is for a current-generation instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentOption:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_deploymentOption</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommendation is for a reservation in a single Availability Zone or a
--   reservation with a backup in a second Availability Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:family:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_family</a> - The instance family of the
--   recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_instanceType</a> - The type of instance that
--   Amazon Web Services recommends.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseModel:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_licenseModel</a> - The license model that the
--   recommended reservation supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeFlexEligible:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_sizeFlexEligible</a> - Determines whether the
--   recommended reservation is size flexible.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_region</a> - The Amazon Web Services Region of
--   the recommended reservation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseEngine:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEngine</a> - The database engine that
--   the recommended reservation supports.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseEdition:RDSInstanceDetails'</a>,
--   <a>rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEdition</a> - The database edition that
--   the recommended reservation supports.
newRDSInstanceDetails :: RDSInstanceDetails

-- | Determines whether the recommendation is for a current-generation
--   instance.
rDSInstanceDetails_currentGeneration :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | Determines whether the recommendation is for a reservation in a single
--   Availability Zone or a reservation with a backup in a second
--   Availability Zone.
rDSInstanceDetails_deploymentOption :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance family of the recommended reservation.
rDSInstanceDetails_family :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
rDSInstanceDetails_instanceType :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The license model that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_licenseModel :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.
rDSInstanceDetails_sizeFlexEligible :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.
rDSInstanceDetails_region :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The database engine that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEngine :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The database edition that the recommended reservation supports.
rDSInstanceDetails_databaseEdition :: Lens' RDSInstanceDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The aggregated numbers for your reservation usage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationAggregates</a> smart constructor.
data ReservationAggregates
ReservationAggregates' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReservationAggregates

-- | How many reservation hours that you purchased.
[$sel:purchasedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of reservation hours that you used.
[$sel:totalActualHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of reservation time that you used.
[$sel:utilizationPercentage:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:totalAmortizedFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you didn't use. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:unusedUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The unrealized savings because of purchasing and using a reservation.
[$sel:unrealizedSavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The cost of unused hours for your reservation.
[$sel:rICostForUnusedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of reservation hours that you didn't use.
[$sel:unusedHours:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The realized savings because of purchasing and using a reservation.
[$sel:realizedSavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you purchased. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:purchasedUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The upfront cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:amortizedUpfrontFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly cost of your reservation. It's amortized over the
--   reservation period.
[$sel:amortizedRecurringFee:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:utilizationPercentageInUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much you saved due to purchasing and utilizing reservation. Amazon
--   Web Services calculates this by subtracting <tt>TotalAmortizedFee</tt>
--   from <tt>OnDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed</tt>.
[$sel:netRISavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much your reservation costs if charged On-Demand rates.
[$sel:onDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | How much you might save if you use your entire reservation.
[$sel:totalPotentialRISavings:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of Amazon EC2 reservation hours that you used. It's
--   converted to normalized units. Normalized units are available only for
--   Amazon EC2 usage after November 11, 2017.
[$sel:totalActualUnits:ReservationAggregates'] :: ReservationAggregates -> Maybe Text

-- | A specific reservation that Amazon Web Services recommends for
--   purchase.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationPurchaseRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ReservationPurchaseRecommendation
ReservationPurchaseRecommendation' :: Maybe TermInYears -> Maybe ReservationPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe ServiceSpecification -> Maybe AccountScope -> Maybe [ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail] -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays -> Maybe PaymentOption -> ReservationPurchaseRecommendation

--   years.

--   for.

--   purchase this instance for. For example, you can purchase this
--   reservation for an entire organization in Amazon Web Services
--   Organizations.
[$sel:accountScope:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

[$sel:recommendationDetails:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe [ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail]

--   when making this recommendation.
[$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The payment option for the reservation (for example,
--   <tt>AllUpfront</tt> or <tt>NoUpfront</tt>).
[$sel:paymentOption:ReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: ReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe PaymentOption

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your
--   recommended reservation purchases.

--   to start saving you money, in months.

--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_maximumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour</a>

--   during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to
--   calculate your recommended reservation purchases.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recurringStandardMonthlyCost:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,

--   this instance.

--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedMonthlySavingsPercentage:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedMonthlySavingsPercentage</a>

--   recommendation could save you in a month, as a percentage of your
--   overall costs.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendedNormalizedUnitsToPurchase:ReservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>reservationPurchaseRecommendationDetail_recommendedNormalizedUnitsToPurchase</a>

--   that you purchase.

--   The average utilization of your instances. Amazon Web Services uses

-- | The result that's associated with a time period.
--

-- | The total amount of cost or usage accrued during the time period.
[$sel:total:ResultByTime'] :: ResultByTime -> Maybe (HashMap Text MetricValue)

[$sel:estimated:ResultByTime'] :: ResultByTime -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultByTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   groups that this time period includes.

--   The time period that the result covers.

-- | Recommendations to rightsize resources.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRightsizingRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data RightsizingRecommendation
RightsizingRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [FindingReasonCode] -> Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail -> Maybe CurrentInstance -> Maybe RightsizingType -> Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail -> RightsizingRecommendation

-- | The account that this recommendation is for.
[$sel:accountId:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such
--   as under or over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU,
--   Memory, Network).
[$sel:findingReasonCodes:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe [FindingReasonCode]

-- | The details for the modification recommendations.
[$sel:modifyRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail

-- | Context regarding the current instance.
[$sel:currentInstance:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe CurrentInstance

-- | A recommendation to either terminate or modify the resource.
[$sel:rightsizingType:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe RightsizingType

-- | The details for termination recommendations.
[$sel:terminateRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'] :: RightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>RightsizingRecommendation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_accountId</a> - The account that this
--   recommendation is for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:findingReasonCodes:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_findingReasonCodes</a> - The list of
--   possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such as under or
--   over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU, Memory,
--   Network).
--   
--   <a>$sel:modifyRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_modifyRecommendationDetail</a> - The
--   details for the modification recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentInstance:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_currentInstance</a> - Context regarding
--   the current instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rightsizingType:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_rightsizingType</a> - A recommendation to
--   either terminate or modify the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminateRecommendationDetail:RightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_terminateRecommendationDetail</a> - The
--   details for termination recommendations.
newRightsizingRecommendation :: RightsizingRecommendation

-- | The account that this recommendation is for.
rightsizingRecommendation_accountId :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such
--   as under or over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU,
--   Memory, Network).
rightsizingRecommendation_findingReasonCodes :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe [FindingReasonCode])

-- | The details for the modification recommendations.
rightsizingRecommendation_modifyRecommendationDetail :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe ModifyRecommendationDetail)

-- | Context regarding the current instance.
rightsizingRecommendation_currentInstance :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe CurrentInstance)

-- | A recommendation to either terminate or modify the resource.
rightsizingRecommendation_rightsizingType :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe RightsizingType)

-- | The details for termination recommendations.
rightsizingRecommendation_terminateRecommendationDetail :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendation (Maybe TerminateRecommendationDetail)

-- | You can use <tt>RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration</tt> to
--   customize recommendations across two attributes. You can choose to
--   view recommendations for instances within the same instance families
--   or across different instance families. You can also choose to view
--   your estimated savings that are associated with recommendations with
--   consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or neither.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRightsizingRecommendationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration
RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration' :: RecommendationTarget -> Bool -> RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration

-- | The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or
--   recommendations for instances across other families. The default value
--   is <tt>SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>.
[$sel:recommendationTarget:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'] :: RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration -> RecommendationTarget

-- | The option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your
--   savings calculation. The default value is <tt>TRUE</tt>.
[$sel:benefitsConsidered:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'] :: RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTarget:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_recommendationTarget</a> -
--   The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or
--   recommendations for instances across other families. The default value
--   is <tt>SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:benefitsConsidered:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_benefitsConsidered</a> - The
--   option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your
--   savings calculation. The default value is <tt>TRUE</tt>.
newRightsizingRecommendationConfiguration :: RecommendationTarget -> Bool -> RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration

-- | The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or
--   recommendations for instances across other families. The default value
--   is <tt>SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>.
rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_recommendationTarget :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration RecommendationTarget

-- | The option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your
--   savings calculation. The default value is <tt>TRUE</tt>.
rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_benefitsConsidered :: Lens' RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration Bool

-- | Metadata for this recommendation set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRightsizingRecommendationMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RightsizingRecommendationMetadata

-- | The ID for this specific recommendation.
[$sel:recommendationId:RightsizingRecommendationMetadata'] :: RightsizingRecommendationMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp for when Amazon Web Services made this recommendation.

-- | Additional metadata that might be applicable to the recommendation.

-- | The number of days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services
--   considers when making this recommendation.

--   relative to the total On-Demand costs that are associated with these
--   instances.

-- | The combination of Amazon Web Services service, linked account,
--   Region, and usage type where a cost anomaly is observed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRootCause</a> smart constructor.
data RootCause
RootCause' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RootCause

-- | The Amazon Web Services service name that's associated with the cost
--   anomaly.
[$sel:service:RootCause'] :: RootCause -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>UsageType</tt> value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
[$sel:usageType:RootCause'] :: RootCause -> Maybe Text

-- | The member account value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
[$sel:linkedAccount:RootCause'] :: RootCause -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that's associated with the cost
--   anomaly.
[$sel:region:RootCause'] :: RootCause -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RootCause</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:service:RootCause'</a>, <a>rootCause_service</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services service name that's associated with the cost anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:usageType:RootCause'</a>, <a>rootCause_usageType</a> - The
--   <tt>UsageType</tt> value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:linkedAccount:RootCause'</a>, <a>rootCause_linkedAccount</a> -
--   The member account value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:RootCause'</a>, <a>rootCause_region</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services Region that's associated with the cost anomaly.
newRootCause :: RootCause

-- | The Amazon Web Services service name that's associated with the cost
--   anomaly.
rootCause_service :: Lens' RootCause (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>UsageType</tt> value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
rootCause_usageType :: Lens' RootCause (Maybe Text)

-- | The member account value that's associated with the cost anomaly.
rootCause_linkedAccount :: Lens' RootCause (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region that's associated with the cost
--   anomaly.
rootCause_region :: Lens' RootCause (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains your request parameters, Savings Plan Recommendations
--   Summary, and Details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation
SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation' :: Maybe [SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail] -> Maybe TermInYears -> Maybe AccountScope -> Maybe SupportedSavingsPlansType -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays -> Maybe PaymentOption -> Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation

-- | Details for the Savings Plans we recommend that you purchase to cover
--   existing Savings Plans eligible workloads.
[$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetails:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe [SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail]

-- | The Savings Plans recommendation term in years. It's used to generate
--   the recommendation.
[$sel:termInYears:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe TermInYears

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations that include the management
--   account and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If
--   the value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for
--   individual member accounts only.
[$sel:accountScope:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

-- | The requested Savings Plans recommendation type.
[$sel:savingsPlansType:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe SupportedSavingsPlansType

-- | The lookback period in days, used to generate the recommendation.
[$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The payment option used to generate the recommendation.
[$sel:paymentOption:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe PaymentOption

-- | Summary metrics for your Savings Plans Recommendations.
[$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetails:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetails</a>
--   - Details for the Savings Plans we recommend that you purchase to
--   cover existing Savings Plans eligible workloads.
--   
--   <a>$sel:termInYears:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears</a> - The Savings
--   Plans recommendation term in years. It's used to generate the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountScope:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope</a> - The account
--   scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web Services
--   calculates recommendations that include the management account and
--   member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the value is
--   <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for individual member
--   accounts only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansType:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansType</a> - The
--   requested Savings Plans recommendation type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays</a> - The
--   lookback period in days, used to generate the recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:paymentOption:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_paymentOption</a> - The payment
--   option used to generate the recommendation.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary</a>
--   - Summary metrics for your Savings Plans Recommendations.
newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation

--   existing Savings Plans eligible workloads.

--   the recommendation.
savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears :: Lens' SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe TermInYears)

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations that include the management
--   account and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If
--   the value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for

-- | Details for your recommended Savings Plans.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail
SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SavingsPlansDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to generate the
--   recommendations and present potential savings.
[$sel:currencyCode:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The average value of hourly On-Demand spend over the lookback period
--   of the applicable usage type.
[$sel:currentAverageHourlyOnDemandSpend:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Details for your recommended Savings Plans.
[$sel:savingsPlansDetails:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe SavingsPlansDetails

-- | The lowest value of hourly On-Demand spend over the lookback period of
--   the applicable usage type.
[$sel:currentMinimumHourlyOnDemandSpend:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated return on investment that's based on the recommended
--   Savings Plans that you purchased. This is calculated as
--   <tt>estimatedSavingsAmount</tt>/ <tt>estimatedSPCost</tt>*100.
[$sel:estimatedROI:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The highest value of hourly On-Demand spend over the lookback period
--   of the applicable usage type.
[$sel:currentMaximumHourlyOnDemandSpend:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated savings amount that's based on the recommended Savings
--   Plans over the length of the lookback period.
[$sel:estimatedSavingsAmount:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>AccountID</tt> the recommendation is generated for.
[$sel:accountId:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated monthly savings amount based on the recommended Savings
--   Plans.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavingsAmount:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The remaining On-Demand cost estimated to not be covered by the
--   recommended Savings Plans, over the length of the lookback period.
[$sel:estimatedOnDemandCost:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated On-Demand costs you would expect with no additional
--   commitment, based on your usage of the selected time period and the
--   Savings Plans you own.
[$sel:estimatedOnDemandCostWithCurrentCommitment:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The upfront cost of the recommended Savings Plans, based on the
--   selected payment option.
[$sel:upfrontCost:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The cost of the recommended Savings Plans over the length of the
--   lookback period.
[$sel:estimatedSPCost:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost of
--   applicable On-Demand usage over the lookback period.
[$sel:estimatedSavingsPercentage:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated utilization of the recommended Savings Plans.
[$sel:estimatedAverageUtilization:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The recommended hourly commitment level for the Savings Plans type and
--   the configuration that's based on the usage during the lookback
--   period.
[$sel:hourlyCommitmentToPurchase:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Summary metrics for your Savings Plans Purchase Recommendations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary
SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to generate the
--   recommendations and present potential savings.
[$sel:currencyCode:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The recommended Savings Plans cost on a daily (24 hourly) basis.
[$sel:dailyCommitmentToPurchase:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated total cost of the usage after purchasing the recommended
--   Savings Plans. This is a sum of the cost of Savings Plans during this
--   term, and the remaining On-Demand usage.
[$sel:estimatedTotalCost:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated return on investment that's based on the recommended
--   Savings Plans and estimated savings.
[$sel:estimatedROI:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated total savings over the lookback period, based on the
--   purchase of the recommended Savings Plans.
[$sel:estimatedSavingsAmount:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated monthly savings amount that's based on the recommended
--   Savings Plans purchase.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavingsAmount:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated On-Demand costs you would expect with no additional
--   commitment. It's based on your usage of the selected time period and
--   the Savings Plans you own.
[$sel:estimatedOnDemandCostWithCurrentCommitment:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated savings relative to the total cost of On-Demand usage,
--   over the lookback period. This is calculated as
--   <tt>estimatedSavingsAmount</tt>/ <tt>CurrentOnDemandSpend</tt>*100.
[$sel:estimatedSavingsPercentage:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The aggregate number of Savings Plans recommendations that exist for
--   your account.
[$sel:totalRecommendationCount:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The current total on demand spend of the applicable usage types over
--   the lookback period.
[$sel:currentOnDemandSpend:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The recommended hourly commitment that's based on the recommendation
--   parameters.
[$sel:hourlyCommitmentToPurchase:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary'] :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of savings that you're accumulating, against the public
--   On-Demand rate of the usage accrued in an account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansSavings</a> smart constructor.
data SavingsPlansSavings
SavingsPlansSavings' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SavingsPlansSavings

-- | The savings amount that you're accumulating for the usage that's
--   covered by a Savings Plans, when compared to the On-Demand equivalent
--   of the same usage.
[$sel:netSavings:SavingsPlansSavings'] :: SavingsPlansSavings -> Maybe Text

-- | How much the amount that the usage would have cost if it was accrued
--   at the On-Demand rate.
[$sel:onDemandCostEquivalent:SavingsPlansSavings'] :: SavingsPlansSavings -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SavingsPlansSavings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:netSavings:SavingsPlansSavings'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansSavings_netSavings</a> - The savings amount that you're
--   accumulating for the usage that's covered by a Savings Plans, when
--   compared to the On-Demand equivalent of the same usage.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandCostEquivalent:SavingsPlansSavings'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansSavings_onDemandCostEquivalent</a> - How much the
--   amount that the usage would have cost if it was accrued at the
--   On-Demand rate.
newSavingsPlansSavings :: SavingsPlansSavings

--   covered by a Savings Plans, when compared to the On-Demand equivalent
--   of the same usage.

-- | How much the amount that the usage would have cost if it was accrued
--   at the On-Demand rate.
savingsPlansSavings_onDemandCostEquivalent :: Lens' SavingsPlansSavings (Maybe Text)

-- | The measurement of how well you're using your existing Savings Plans.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansUtilization</a> smart constructor.
data SavingsPlansUtilization
SavingsPlansUtilization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SavingsPlansUtilization

-- | The amount of your Savings Plans commitment that wasn't consumed from
--   Savings Plans eligible usage in a specific period.
[$sel:unusedCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'] :: SavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of <tt>UsedCommitment</tt> divided by the
--   <tt>TotalCommitment</tt> for your Savings Plans.
[$sel:utilizationPercentage:SavingsPlansUtilization'] :: SavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The total amount of Savings Plans commitment that's been purchased in
--   an account (or set of accounts).
[$sel:totalCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'] :: SavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | The amount of your Savings Plans commitment that was consumed from
--   Savings Plans eligible usage in a specific period.
[$sel:usedCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'] :: SavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SavingsPlansUtilization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unusedCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilization_unusedCommitment</a> - The amount of your
--   Savings Plans commitment that wasn't consumed from Savings Plans
--   eligible usage in a specific period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilizationPercentage:SavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilization_utilizationPercentage</a> - The amount of
--   <tt>UsedCommitment</tt> divided by the <tt>TotalCommitment</tt> for
--   your Savings Plans.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilization_totalCommitment</a> - The total amount of
--   Savings Plans commitment that's been purchased in an account (or set
--   of accounts).
--   
--   <a>$sel:usedCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilization_usedCommitment</a> - The amount of your
--   Savings Plans commitment that was consumed from Savings Plans eligible
--   usage in a specific period.
newSavingsPlansUtilization :: SavingsPlansUtilization

-- | The amount of your Savings Plans commitment that wasn't consumed from
--   Savings Plans eligible usage in a specific period.
savingsPlansUtilization_unusedCommitment :: Lens' SavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of <tt>UsedCommitment</tt> divided by the
--   <tt>TotalCommitment</tt> for your Savings Plans.
savingsPlansUtilization_utilizationPercentage :: Lens' SavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The total amount of Savings Plans commitment that's been purchased in
--   an account (or set of accounts).
savingsPlansUtilization_totalCommitment :: Lens' SavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount of your Savings Plans commitment that was consumed from
--   Savings Plans eligible usage in a specific period.
savingsPlansUtilization_usedCommitment :: Lens' SavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | The aggregated utilization metrics for your Savings Plans usage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates
SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates' :: Maybe SavingsPlansAmortizedCommitment -> Maybe SavingsPlansSavings -> SavingsPlansUtilization -> SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates

-- | The total amortized commitment for a Savings Plans. This includes the
--   sum of the upfront and recurring Savings Plans fees.
[$sel:amortizedCommitment:SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates'] :: SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates -> Maybe SavingsPlansAmortizedCommitment

-- | The amount saved by using existing Savings Plans. Savings returns both
--   net savings from Savings Plans, as well as the
--   <tt>onDemandCostEquivalent</tt> of the Savings Plans when considering
--   the utilization rate.
[$sel:savings:SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates'] :: SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates -> Maybe SavingsPlansSavings

-- | A ratio of your effectiveness of using existing Savings Plans to apply
--   to workloads that are Savings Plans eligible.
[$sel:utilization:SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates'] :: SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates -> SavingsPlansUtilization

-- | Create a value of <a>SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   total amortized commitment for a Savings Plans. This includes the sum
--   of the upfront and recurring Savings Plans fees.
--   
--   <a>$sel:savings:SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilizationAggregates_savings</a> - The amount saved by
--   using existing Savings Plans. Savings returns both net savings from
--   Savings Plans, as well as the <tt>onDemandCostEquivalent</tt> of the
--   Savings Plans when considering the utilization rate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:utilization:SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansUtilizationAggregates_utilization</a> - A ratio of your
--   effectiveness of using existing Savings Plans to apply to workloads

newSavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates :: SavingsPlansUtilization -> SavingsPlansUtilizationAggregates

--   address or SNS Amazon Resource Name (ARN). This depends on the

--   the <tt>Type</tt>.

subscriber_type :: Lens' Subscriber (Maybe SubscriberType)

-- | The values that are available for a tag.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> aren't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all tags. That is,
--   it's filtered on resources with no tags.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the tag
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it's filtered on resources without the
--   given tag key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagValues</a> smart constructor.
data TagValues
TagValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> TagValues

-- | The specific value of the tag.
[$sel:values:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The key for the tag.
[$sel:key:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
[$sel:matchOptions:TagValues'] :: TagValues -> Maybe [MatchOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>TagValues</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_values</a> - The specific
--   value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_key</a> - The key for the
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_matchOptions</a> -
--   The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newTagValues :: TagValues

-- | The specific value of the tag.
tagValues_values :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe [Text])

-- | The key for the tag.
tagValues_key :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
tagValues_matchOptions :: Lens' TagValues (Maybe [MatchOption])

-- | Details on recommended instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetInstance</a> smart constructor.
data TargetInstance
TargetInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceDetails -> Maybe [PlatformDifference] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceUtilization -> TargetInstance

-- | The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs
--   for this instance.
[$sel:currencyCode:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Details on the target instance type.
[$sel:resourceDetails:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe ResourceDetails

-- | Explains the actions you might need to take in order to successfully
--   migrate your workloads from the current instance type to the
--   recommended instance type.
[$sel:platformDifferences:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe [PlatformDifference]

-- | Determines whether this recommendation is the defaulted Amazon Web
--   Services recommendation.
[$sel:defaultTargetInstance:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The expected cost to operate this instance type on a monthly basis.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlyCost:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The estimated savings that result from modification, on a monthly
--   basis.
[$sel:estimatedMonthlySavings:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The expected utilization metrics for target instance type.
[$sel:expectedResourceUtilization:TargetInstance'] :: TargetInstance -> Maybe ResourceUtilization

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
