--   <a>targetInstance_currencyCode</a> - The currency code that Amazon Web
--   Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDetails:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_resourceDetails</a> - Details on the target instance
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platformDifferences:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_platformDifferences</a> - Explains the actions you
--   might need to take in order to successfully migrate your workloads
--   from the current instance type to the recommended instance type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTargetInstance:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_defaultTargetInstance</a> - Determines whether this
--   recommendation is the defaulted Amazon Web Services recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedMonthlyCost:TargetInstance'</a>,
--   <a>targetInstance_estimatedMonthlyCost</a> - The expected cost to
--   operate this instance type on a monthly basis.
--

--   utilization metrics for target instance type.
newTargetInstance :: TargetInstance

--   for this instance.

--   basis.
targetInstance_estimatedMonthlySavings :: Lens' TargetInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The expected utilization metrics for target instance type.
targetInstance_expectedResourceUtilization :: Lens' TargetInstance (Maybe ResourceUtilization)

-- | Filters cost anomalies based on the total impact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTotalImpactFilter</a> smart constructor.
data TotalImpactFilter
TotalImpactFilter' :: Maybe Double -> NumericOperator -> Double -> TotalImpactFilter

-- | The upper bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:endValue:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> Maybe Double

-- | The comparing value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:numericOperator:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> NumericOperator

-- | The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
[$sel:startValue:TotalImpactFilter'] :: TotalImpactFilter -> Double

-- | Create a value of <a>TotalImpactFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endValue:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_endValue</a> - The upper bound dollar value
--   that's used in the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numericOperator:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_numericOperator</a> - The comparing value that's
--   used in the filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startValue:TotalImpactFilter'</a>,
--   <a>totalImpactFilter_startValue</a> - The lower bound dollar value
--   that's used in the filter.
newTotalImpactFilter :: NumericOperator -> Double -> TotalImpactFilter

-- | The upper bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
totalImpactFilter_endValue :: Lens' TotalImpactFilter (Maybe Double)

-- | The comparing value that's used in the filter.
totalImpactFilter_numericOperator :: Lens' TotalImpactFilter NumericOperator

-- | The lower bound dollar value that's used in the filter.
totalImpactFilter_startValue :: Lens' TotalImpactFilter Double

-- | The amount of utilization, in hours.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUtilizationByTime</a> smart constructor.
data UtilizationByTime
UtilizationByTime' :: Maybe [ReservationUtilizationGroup] -> Maybe DateInterval -> Maybe ReservationAggregates -> UtilizationByTime

-- | The groups that this utilization result uses.
[$sel:groups:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe [ReservationUtilizationGroup]

-- | The period of time that this utilization was used for.
[$sel:timePeriod:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe DateInterval

-- | The total number of reservation hours that were used.
[$sel:total:UtilizationByTime'] :: UtilizationByTime -> Maybe ReservationAggregates

--   omitted.

--   The total number of reservation hours that were used.

-- | Returns the name, ARN, <tt>NumberOfRules</tt> and effective dates of
--   all Cost Categories defined in the account. You have the option to use
--   <tt>EffectiveOn</tt> to return a list of Cost Categories that were
--   active on a specific date. If there is no <tt>EffectiveOn</tt>
--   specified, you’ll see Cost Categories that are effective on the
--   current date. If Cost Category is still effective,
--   <tt>EffectiveEnd</tt> is omitted in the response.
--   <tt>ListCostCategoryDefinitions</tt> supports pagination. The request
--   can have a <tt>MaxResults</tt> range up to 100.

-- | Retrieves a forecast for how much Amazon Web Services predicts that
--   you will use over the forecast time period that you select, based on
--   your past usage.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetUsageForecast

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetUsageForecast</a> smart constructor.
data GetUsageForecast
GetUsageForecast' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Expression -> DateInterval -> Metric -> Granularity -> GetUsageForecast

-- | Cost Explorer always returns the mean forecast as a single point. You
--   can request a prediction interval around the mean by specifying a
--   confidence level. The higher the confidence level, the more confident
--   Cost Explorer is about the actual value falling in the prediction
--   interval. Higher confidence levels result in wider prediction
--   intervals.
[$sel:predictionIntervalLevel:GetUsageForecast'] :: GetUsageForecast -> Maybe Natural

-- | The filters that you want to use to filter your forecast. The
--   <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> API supports filtering by the following
--   dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AZ</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PURCHASE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RECORD_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATING_SYSTEM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TENANCY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SCOPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PLATFORM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DATABASE_ENGINE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>BILLING_ENTITY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESERVATION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filter':GetUsageForecast'] :: GetUsageForecast -> Maybe Expression

-- | The start and end dates of the period that you want to retrieve usage
--   forecast for. The start date is inclusive, but the end date is
--   exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is
--   retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including
--   <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>. The start
--   date must be equal to or later than the current date to avoid a
--   validation error.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetUsageForecast'] :: GetUsageForecast -> DateInterval

-- | Which metric Cost Explorer uses to create your forecast.
--   
--   Valid values for a <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> call are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>USAGE_QUANTITY</li>
--   <li>NORMALIZED_USAGE_AMOUNT</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:metric:GetUsageForecast'] :: GetUsageForecast -> Metric

-- | How granular you want the forecast to be. You can get 3 months of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12 months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
[$sel:granularity:GetUsageForecast'] :: GetUsageForecast -> Granularity

-- | Create a value of <a>GetUsageForecast</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:predictionIntervalLevel:GetUsageForecast'</a>,
--   <a>getUsageForecast_predictionIntervalLevel</a> - Cost Explorer always
--   returns the mean forecast as a single point. You can request a
--   prediction interval around the mean by specifying a confidence level.
--   The higher the confidence level, the more confident Cost Explorer is
--   about the actual value falling in the prediction interval. Higher
--   confidence levels result in wider prediction intervals.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetUsageForecast'</a>, <a>getUsageForecast_filter</a>
--   - The filters that you want to use to filter your forecast. The
--   <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> API supports filtering by the following
--   dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AZ</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PURCHASE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RECORD_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATING_SYSTEM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TENANCY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SCOPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PLATFORM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DATABASE_ENGINE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>BILLING_ENTITY</pre></li>

--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>

--   period that you want to retrieve usage forecast for. The start date is
--   inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>. The start date must be equal to or

--   Which metric Cost Explorer uses to create your forecast.

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>USAGE_QUANTITY</li>
--   <li>NORMALIZED_USAGE_AMOUNT</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetUsageForecast'</a>,
--   <a>getUsageForecast_granularity</a> - How granular you want the
--   forecast to be. You can get 3 months of <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12
--   months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
newGetUsageForecast :: DateInterval -> Metric -> Granularity -> GetUsageForecast

-- | Cost Explorer always returns the mean forecast as a single point. You
--   can request a prediction interval around the mean by specifying a
--   confidence level. The higher the confidence level, the more confident
--   Cost Explorer is about the actual value falling in the prediction
--   interval. Higher confidence levels result in wider prediction
--   intervals.

--   </ul>
getUsageForecast_filter :: Lens' GetUsageForecast (Maybe Expression)

-- | The start and end dates of the period that you want to retrieve usage
--   forecast for. The start date is inclusive, but the end date is
--   exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetUsageForecastResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetUsageForecastResponse

-- | The forecasts for your query, in order. For <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts,
--   this is a list of days. For <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts, this is a list
--   of months.
[$sel:forecastResultsByTime:GetUsageForecastResponse'] :: GetUsageForecastResponse -> Maybe [ForecastResult]

-- | How much you're forecasted to use over the forecast period.
[$sel:total:GetUsageForecastResponse'] :: GetUsageForecastResponse -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | Queries for available tag keys and tag values for a specified period.
--   You can search the tag values for an arbitrary string.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetTags

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetTags</a> smart constructor.
data GetTags
GetTags' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [SortDefinition] -> DateInterval -> GetTags

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe Text

-- | The value that you want to search for.
[$sel:searchString:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe Text

-- | The key of the tag that you want to return values for.
[$sel:tagKey:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe Expression

-- | This field is only used when SortBy is provided in the request. The
--   maximum number of objects that to be returned for this request. If
--   MaxResults is not specified with SortBy, the request will return 1000
--   results as the default value for this parameter.
--   
--   For <tt>GetTags</tt>, MaxResults has an upper limit of 1000.
[$sel:maxResults:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe Natural

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The key represents cost and usage metrics. The following values are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>BlendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetAmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetUnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsageQuantity</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NormalizedUsageAmount</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   When using <tt>SortBy</tt>, <tt>NextPageToken</tt> and
--   <tt>SearchString</tt> are not supported.
[$sel:sortBy:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> Maybe [SortDefinition]

-- | The start and end dates for retrieving the dimension values. The start
--   date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetTags'] :: GetTags -> DateInterval

-- | Retrieves attribute data along with aggregate utilization and savings
--   data for a given time period. This doesn't support granular or grouped
--   data (daily/monthly) in response. You can't retrieve data by dates in
--   a single response similar to <tt>GetSavingsPlanUtilization</tt>, but
--   you have the option to make multiple calls to
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlanUtilizationDetails</tt> by providing individual
--   dates. You can use <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> in
--   <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt> to determine the possible dimension values.
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlanUtilizationDetails</tt> internally groups data by
--   <tt>SavingsPlansArn</tt>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails
GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [SavingsPlansDataType] -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextToken:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | The data type.
[$sel:dataType:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> Maybe [SavingsPlansDataType]

-- | Filters Savings Plans utilization coverage data for active Savings
--   Plans dimensions. You can filter data with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PAYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails</tt> uses the same
--   <a>Expression</a> object as the other operations, but only
--   <tt>AND</tt> is supported among each dimension.
[$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> Maybe Expression

-- | The number of items to be returned in a response. The default is
--   <tt>20</tt>, with a minimum value of <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:maxResults:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> Maybe Natural

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetSavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedRecurringCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedUpfrontCommitment</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
[$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> Maybe SortDefinition

-- | The time period that you want the usage and costs for. The
--   <tt>Start</tt> date must be within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date
--   must be after the <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date.
--   Future dates can't be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails -> DateInterval

-- | Retrieves the Savings Plans utilization for your account across date
--   ranges with daily or monthly granularity. Management account in an
--   organization have access to member accounts. You can use
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> in <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt> to determine the
--   possible dimension values.
--   
--   You cannot group by any dimension values for
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetSavingsPlansUtilization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSavingsPlansUtilization</a> smart constructor.
data GetSavingsPlansUtilization
GetSavingsPlansUtilization' :: Maybe Granularity -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetSavingsPlansUtilization

-- | The granularity of the Amazon Web Services utillization data for your
--   Savings Plans.
--   
--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
[$sel:granularity:GetSavingsPlansUtilization'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Granularity

-- | Filters Savings Plans utilization coverage data for active Savings
--   Plans dimensions. You can filter data with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PAYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension.
[$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansUtilization'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe Expression

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetSavings</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
[$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansUtilization'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilization -> Maybe SortDefinition

-- | The time period that you want the usage and costs for. The
--   <tt>Start</tt> date must be within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date
--   must be after the <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date.
--   Future dates can't be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetSavingsPlansUtilization'] :: GetSavingsPlansUtilization -> DateInterval

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations including the management account
--   and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the
--   value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for
--   individual member accounts only.
[$sel:accountScope:GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

-- | You can filter your recommendations by Account ID with the
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> dimension. To filter your recommendations by
--   Account ID, specify <tt>Key</tt> as <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and
--   <tt>Value</tt> as the comma-separated Acount ID(s) for which you want
--   to see Savings Plans purchase recommendations.
--   
--   For GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation, the <tt>Filter</tt> does
--   not include <tt>CostCategories</tt> or <tt>Tags</tt>. It only includes
--   <tt>Dimensions</tt>. With <tt>Dimensions</tt>, <tt>Key</tt> must be
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and <tt>Value</tt> can be a single Account ID
--   or multiple comma-separated Account IDs for which you want to see
--   Savings Plans Purchase Recommendations. <tt>AND</tt> and <tt>OR</tt>
--   operators are not supported.
[$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Expression

-- | The number of recommendations that you want returned in a single
--   response object.
[$sel:pageSize:GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Natural

-- | The Savings Plans recommendation type requested.
[$sel:savingsPlansType:GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> SupportedSavingsPlansType

-- | The savings plan recommendation term used to generate these
--   recommendations.
[$sel:termInYears:GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation -> TermInYears

-- | The payment option used to generate these recommendations.

-- | The lookback period used to generate the recommendation.

-- | Retrieves the Savings Plans covered for your account. This enables you
--   to see how much of your cost is covered by a Savings Plan. An
--   organization’s management account can see the coverage of the
--   associated member accounts. This supports dimensions, Cost Categories,
--   and nested expressions. For any time period, you can filter data for
--   Savings Plans usage with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To determine valid values for a dimension, use the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetSavingsPlansCoverage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSavingsPlansCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data GetSavingsPlansCoverage
GetSavingsPlansCoverage' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Granularity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetSavingsPlansCoverage

-- | You can group the data using the attributes <tt>INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>,
--   <tt>REGION</tt>, or <tt>SERVICE</tt>.
[$sel:groupBy:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe [GroupDefinition]

-- | The measurement that you want your Savings Plans coverage reported in.
--   The only valid value is <tt>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlans</tt>.
[$sel:metrics:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The granularity of the Amazon Web Services cost data for your Savings
--   Plans. <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set if <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set.
--   
--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
[$sel:granularity:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe Granularity

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextToken:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe Text

-- | Filters Savings Plans coverage data by dimensions. You can filter data
--   for Savings Plans usage with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension. If there are multiple values for a dimension,
--   they are OR'd together.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
[$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe Expression

-- | The number of items to be returned in a response. The default is
--   <tt>20</tt>, with a minimum value of <tt>1</tt>.
[$sel:maxResults:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe Natural

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlan</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CoveragePercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>InstanceFamily</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Region</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Service</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
[$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> Maybe SortDefinition

-- | The time period that you want the usage and costs for. The
--   <tt>Start</tt> date must be within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date
--   must be after the <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date.
--   Future dates can't be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'] :: GetSavingsPlansCoverage -> DateInterval

--   fields omitted.

-- | Creates recommendations that help you save cost by identifying idle
--   and underutilized Amazon EC2 instances.
--   
--   Recommendations are generated to either downsize or terminate
--   instances, along with providing savings detail and metrics. For
--   details on calculation and function, see <a>Optimizing Your Cost with
--   Rightsizing Recommendations</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management
--   User Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetRightsizingRecommendation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRightsizingRecommendation</a> smart constructor.
data GetRightsizingRecommendation
GetRightsizingRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> GetRightsizingRecommendation

-- | The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you
--   want to retrieve.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetRightsizingRecommendation'] :: GetRightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | Enables you to customize recommendations across two attributes. You
--   can choose to view recommendations for instances within the same
--   instance families or across different instance families. You can also
--   choose to view your estimated savings associated with recommendations
--   with consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or
--   neither.
[$sel:configuration:GetRightsizingRecommendation'] :: GetRightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration
[$sel:filter':GetRightsizingRecommendation'] :: GetRightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe Expression

-- | The number of recommendations that you want returned in a single
--   response object.
[$sel:pageSize:GetRightsizingRecommendation'] :: GetRightsizingRecommendation -> Maybe Natural

-- | The specific service that you want recommendations for. The only valid
--   value for <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> is
--   "<tt>AmazonEC2</tt>".
[$sel:service:GetRightsizingRecommendation'] :: GetRightsizingRecommendation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRightsizingRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetRightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getRightsizingRecommendation_nextPageToken</a> - The pagination
--   token that indicates the next set of results that you want to
--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:GetRightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getRightsizingRecommendation_configuration</a> - Enables you to
--   customize recommendations across two attributes. You can choose to
--   view recommendations for instances within the same instance families
--   or across different instance families. You can also choose to view
--   your estimated savings associated with recommendations with
--   consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or neither.

--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:GetRightsizingRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getRightsizingRecommendation_pageSize</a> - The number of
--   recommendations that you want returned in a single response object.

--   <a>getRightsizingRecommendation_service</a> - The specific service
--   that you want recommendations for. The only valid value for
--   <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> is "<tt>AmazonEC2</tt>".

--   account in an organization have access to member accounts. You can
--   filter data by dimensions in a time period. You can use
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> to determine the possible dimension
--   values. Currently, you can group only by <tt>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</tt>.

-- | Gets recommendations for which reservations to purchase. These
--   recommendations could help you reduce your costs. Reservations provide
--   a discounted hourly rate (up to 75%) compared to On-Demand pricing.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services generates your recommendations by identifying your
--   On-Demand usage during a specific time period and collecting your
--   usage into categories that are eligible for a reservation. After
--   Amazon Web Services has these categories, it simulates every
--   combination of reservations in each category of usage to identify the
--   best number of each type of RI to purchase to maximize your estimated
--   savings.
--   
--   For example, Amazon Web Services automatically aggregates your Amazon
--   EC2 Linux, shared tenancy, and c4 family usage in the US West (Oregon)
--   Region and recommends that you buy size-flexible regional reservations
--   to apply to the c4 family usage. Amazon Web Services recommends the
--   smallest size instance in an instance family. This makes it easier to
--   purchase a size-flexible RI. Amazon Web Services also shows the equal
--   number of normalized units so that you can purchase any instance size
--   that you want. For this example, your RI recommendation would be for
--   <tt>c4.large</tt> because that is the smallest size instance in the c4
--   instance family.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetReservationPurchaseRecommendation</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation
GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TermInYears -> Maybe ServiceSpecification -> Maybe AccountScope -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays -> Maybe PaymentOption -> Text -> GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation

-- | The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you
--   want to retrieve.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Text

-- | The reservation term that you want recommendations for.
[$sel:termInYears:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe TermInYears

-- | The hardware specifications for the service instances that you want
--   recommendations for, such as standard or convertible Amazon EC2
--   instances.
[$sel:serviceSpecification:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe ServiceSpecification

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations including the management account
--   and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the
--   value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for
--   individual member accounts only.
[$sel:accountScope:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe AccountScope

-- | The account ID that is associated with the recommendation.
[$sel:accountId:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Expression

-- | The number of recommendations that you want returned in a single
--   response object.
[$sel:pageSize:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of previous days that you want Amazon Web Services to
--   consider when it calculates your recommendations.
[$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The reservation purchase option that you want recommendations for.
[$sel:paymentOption:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Maybe PaymentOption

-- | The specific service that you want recommendations for.
[$sel:service:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'] :: GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_nextPageToken</a> - The
--   pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you want
--   to retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:termInYears:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears</a> - The
--   reservation term that you want recommendations for.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceSpecification:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_serviceSpecification</a> - The
--   hardware specifications for the service instances that you want
--   recommendations for, such as standard or convertible Amazon EC2
--   instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountScope:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope</a> - The account
--   scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web Services
--   calculates recommendations including the management account and member
--   accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the value is
--   <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for individual member
--   accounts only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_accountId</a> - The account ID
--   that is associated with the recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_filter</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_pageSize</a> - The number of
--   recommendations that you want returned in a single response object.
--

--   <a>$sel:lookbackPeriodInDays:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays</a> - The
--   number of previous days that you want Amazon Web Services to consider
--   when it calculates your recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:paymentOption:GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationPurchaseRecommendation_paymentOption</a> - The
--   reservation purchase option that you want recommendations for.

-- | Retrieves the reservation coverage for your account. This enables you
--   to see how much of your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud, Amazon
--   ElastiCache, Amazon Relational Database Service, or Amazon Redshift
--   usage is covered by a reservation. An organization's management
--   account can see the coverage of the associated member accounts. This
--   supports dimensions, Cost Categories, and nested expressions. For any
--   time period, you can filter data about reservation usage by the
--   following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>SERVICE</li>
--   <li>TAG</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To determine valid values for a dimension, use the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetReservationCoverage

-- | You can use the following request parameters to query for how much of
--   your instance usage a reservation covered.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetReservationCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data GetReservationCoverage

--   reservation. Valid values are <tt>MONTHLY</tt> and <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set, <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set. If
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response object doesn't include
--   <tt>Granularity</tt>, either <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.

-- | Filters utilization data by dimensions. You can filter by the

--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a> object
--   as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported among each
--   dimension. You can nest only one level deep. If there are multiple
--   values for a dimension, they are OR'd together.
--   
--   If you don't provide a <tt>SERVICE</tt> filter, Cost Explorer defaults
--   to EC2.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
[$sel:filter':GetReservationCoverage'] :: GetReservationCoverage -> Maybe Expression

getReservationCoverageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetReservationCoverageResponse Int

-- | The amount of time that your reservations covered.
getReservationCoverageResponse_coveragesByTime :: Lens' GetReservationCoverageResponse [CoverageByTime]

-- | Retrieves all available filter values for a specified filter over a
--   period of time. You can search the dimension values for an arbitrary
--   string.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetDimensionValues

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDimensionValues</a> smart constructor.
data GetDimensionValues
GetDimensionValues' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Context -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [SortDefinition] -> DateInterval -> Dimension -> GetDimensionValues

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe Text

-- | The context for the call to <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>. This can be
--   <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt> or <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. If the context is set to
--   <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, the resulting dimension values can be used in
--   the <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> operation. If the context is
--   set to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, the resulting dimension values can be
--   used in the <tt>GetCostAndUsage</tt> operation.
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE - The Amazon Relational Database Service database.
--   Examples are Aurora or MySQL.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME - The name of the organization that sells you
--   Amazon Web Services services, such as Amazon Web Services.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM - The operating system. Examples are Windows or
--   Linux.</li>
--   <li>OPERATION - The action performed. Examples include
--   <tt>RunInstance</tt> and <tt>CreateBucket</tt>.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>PURCHASE_TYPE - The reservation type of the purchase to which this
--   usage is related. Examples include On-Demand Instances and Standard
--   Reserved Instances.</li>
--   <li>SERVICE - The Amazon Web Services service such as Amazon
--   DynamoDB.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE - The type of usage. An example is
--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:context:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe Context

-- | The value that you want to search the filter values for.
[$sel:searchString:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe Expression

-- | This field is only used when SortBy is provided in the request. The
--   maximum number of objects that to be returned for this request. If
--   MaxResults is not specified with SortBy, the request will return 1000
--   results as the default value for this parameter.
--   
--   For <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>, MaxResults has an upper limit of
--   1000.
[$sel:maxResults:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe Natural

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The key represents cost and usage metrics. The following values are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>BlendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetAmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetUnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsageQuantity</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NormalizedUsageAmount</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   When you specify a <tt>SortBy</tt> paramater, the context must be
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. Further, when using <tt>SortBy</tt>,
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> and <tt>SearchString</tt> are not supported.
[$sel:sortBy:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Maybe [SortDefinition]

-- | The start date and end date for retrieving the dimension values. The
--   start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example,
--   if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> DateInterval

-- | The name of the dimension. Each <tt>Dimension</tt> is available for a
--   different <tt>Context</tt>. For more information, see
--   <tt>Context</tt>.
[$sel:dimension:GetDimensionValues'] :: GetDimensionValues -> Dimension

[$sel:httpStatus:GetDimensionValuesResponse'] :: GetDimensionValuesResponse -> Int

-- | The filters that you used to filter your request. Some dimensions are
--   available only for a specific context.
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE - The Amazon Relational Database Service database.
--   Examples are Aurora or MySQL.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME - The name of the organization that sells you
--   Amazon Web Services services, such as Amazon Web Services.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM - The operating system. Examples are Windows or
--   Linux.</li>
--   <li>OPERATION - The action performed. Examples include
--   <tt>RunInstance</tt> and <tt>CreateBucket</tt>.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>PURCHASE_TYPE - The reservation type of the purchase to which this
--   usage is related. Examples include On-Demand Instances and Standard
--   Reserved Instances.</li>
--   <li>SERVICE - The Amazon Web Services service such as Amazon
--   DynamoDB.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE - The type of usage. An example is
--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Retrieves a forecast for how much Amazon Web Services predicts that
--   you will spend over the forecast time period that you select, based on
--   your past costs.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetCostForecast

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCostForecast</a> smart constructor.
data GetCostForecast
GetCostForecast' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Expression -> DateInterval -> Metric -> Granularity -> GetCostForecast

-- | Cost Explorer always returns the mean forecast as a single point. You
--   can request a prediction interval around the mean by specifying a
--   confidence level. The higher the confidence level, the more confident
--   Cost Explorer is about the actual value falling in the prediction
--   interval. Higher confidence levels result in wider prediction
--   intervals.
[$sel:predictionIntervalLevel:GetCostForecast'] :: GetCostForecast -> Maybe Natural

-- | The filters that you want to use to filter your forecast. The
--   <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> API supports filtering by the following
--   dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AZ</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PURCHASE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RECORD_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OPERATING_SYSTEM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TENANCY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SCOPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PLATFORM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DATABASE_ENGINE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>BILLING_ENTITY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESERVATION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filter':GetCostForecast'] :: GetCostForecast -> Maybe Expression

-- | The period of time that you want the forecast to cover. The start date
--   must be equal to or no later than the current date to avoid a
--   validation error.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetCostForecast'] :: GetCostForecast -> DateInterval

-- | Which metric Cost Explorer uses to create your forecast. For more
--   information about blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the
--   "blended" annotation appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values for a <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> call are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AMORTIZED_COST</li>
--   <li>BLENDED_COST</li>
--   <li>NET_AMORTIZED_COST</li>
--   <li>NET_UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   <li>UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:metric:GetCostForecast'] :: GetCostForecast -> Metric

-- | How granular you want the forecast to be. You can get 3 months of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12 months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
[$sel:granularity:GetCostForecast'] :: GetCostForecast -> Granularity

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCostForecast</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:predictionIntervalLevel:GetCostForecast'</a>,
--   <a>getCostForecast_predictionIntervalLevel</a> - Cost Explorer always
--   returns the mean forecast as a single point. You can request a
--   prediction interval around the mean by specifying a confidence level.
--   The higher the confidence level, the more confident Cost Explorer is
--   about the actual value falling in the prediction interval. Higher
--   confidence levels result in wider prediction intervals.

--   <li>NET_UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   <li>UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   </ul>

--   months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
newGetCostForecast :: DateInterval -> Metric -> Granularity -> GetCostForecast

-- | Cost Explorer always returns the mean forecast as a single point. You
--   can request a prediction interval around the mean by specifying a
--   confidence level. The higher the confidence level, the more confident
--   Cost Explorer is about the actual value falling in the prediction
--   interval. Higher confidence levels result in wider prediction
--   intervals.
getCostForecast_predictionIntervalLevel :: Lens' GetCostForecast (Maybe Natural)

-- | The filters that you want to use to filter your forecast. The
--   <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> API supports filtering by the following
--   dimensions:

--   <li><pre>PLATFORM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DATABASE_ENGINE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>BILLING_ENTITY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESERVATION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>
getCostForecast_filter :: Lens' GetCostForecast (Maybe Expression)

-- | The period of time that you want the forecast to cover. The start date
--   must be equal to or no later than the current date to avoid a
--   validation error.
getCostForecast_timePeriod :: Lens' GetCostForecast DateInterval

-- | Which metric Cost Explorer uses to create your forecast. For more
--   information about blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the
--   "blended" annotation appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values for a <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> call are the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AMORTIZED_COST</li>
--   <li>BLENDED_COST</li>
--   <li>NET_AMORTIZED_COST</li>
--   <li>NET_UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   <li>UNBLENDED_COST</li>
--   </ul>
getCostForecast_metric :: Lens' GetCostForecast Metric

-- | How granular you want the forecast to be. You can get 3 months of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12 months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getCostForecast_granularity :: Lens' GetCostForecast Granularity

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCostForecastResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetCostForecastResponse
GetCostForecastResponse' :: Maybe [ForecastResult] -> Maybe MetricValue -> Int -> GetCostForecastResponse

-- | The forecasts for your query, in order. For <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts,
--   this is a list of days. For <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts, this is a list
--   of months.
[$sel:forecastResultsByTime:GetCostForecastResponse'] :: GetCostForecastResponse -> Maybe [ForecastResult]

-- | How much you are forecasted to spend over the forecast period, in
--   <tt>USD</tt>.
[$sel:total:GetCostForecastResponse'] :: GetCostForecastResponse -> Maybe MetricValue

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetCostForecastResponse'] :: GetCostForecastResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

--   code.

--   cost, they will not be returned by this API.

-- | Retrieves cost and usage metrics with resources for your account. You
--   can specify which cost and usage-related metric, such as
--   <tt>BlendedCosts</tt> or <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>, that you want the
--   request to return. You can also filter and group your data by various
--   dimensions, such as <tt>SERVICE</tt> or <tt>AZ</tt>, in a specific
--   time range. For a complete list of valid dimensions, see the
--   <a>GetDimensionValues</a> operation. Management account in an
--   organization in Organizations have access to all member accounts. This
--   API is currently available for the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud –
--   Compute service only.
--   
--   This is an opt-in only feature. You can enable this feature from the
--   Cost Explorer Settings page. For information on how to access the
--   Settings page, see <a>Controlling Access for Cost Explorer</a> in the
--   <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetCostAndUsageWithResources

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCostAndUsageWithResources</a> smart constructor.
data GetCostAndUsageWithResources
GetCostAndUsageWithResources' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> DateInterval -> Granularity -> Expression -> GetCostAndUsageWithResources

-- | You can group Amazon Web Services costs using up to two different
--   groups: <tt>DIMENSION</tt>, <tt>TAG</tt>, <tt>COST_CATEGORY</tt>.
[$sel:groupBy:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> Maybe [GroupDefinition]

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> Maybe Text

-- | Which metrics are returned in the query. For more information about
--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking the units into account.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours vs. GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt>
--   requests.
[$sel:metrics:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Sets the start and end dates for retrieving Amazon Web Services costs.
--   The range must be within the last 14 days (the start date cannot be
--   earlier than 14 days ago). The start date is inclusive, but the end
--   date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> DateInterval

-- | Sets the Amazon Web Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>,
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set,
--   the response object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>,
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>, <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
[$sel:granularity:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> Granularity

-- | Filters Amazon Web Services costs by different dimensions. For
--   example, you can specify <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>
--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any
--   combination of dimension filters. For more information, see
--   <a>Expression</a>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt> operation requires that you
--   either group by or filter by a <tt>ResourceId</tt>. It requires the
--   <a>Expression</a> <tt>"SERVICE = Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud -
--   Compute"</tt> in the filter.
[$sel:filter':GetCostAndUsageWithResources'] :: GetCostAndUsageWithResources -> Expression

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_groupBy</a> - You can group Amazon Web
--   Services costs using up to two different groups: <tt>DIMENSION</tt>,
--   <tt>TAG</tt>, <tt>COST_CATEGORY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_nextPageToken</a> - The token to
--   retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the
--   token when the response from a previous call has more results than the
--   maximum page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_metrics</a> - Which metrics are
--   returned in the query. For more information about blended and
--   unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation appear on
--   some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking the units into account.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours vs. GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt>
--   requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_timePeriod</a> - Sets the start and
--   end dates for retrieving Amazon Web Services costs. The range must be
--   within the last 14 days (the start date cannot be earlier than 14 days
--   ago). The start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_granularity</a> - Sets the Amazon Web
--   Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>, <tt>DAILY</tt>, or
--   <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response
--   object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>, <tt>MONTHLY</tt>,
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_filter</a> - Filters Amazon Web
--   Services costs by different dimensions. For example, you can specify
--   <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and get the costs that
--   are associated with that account's usage of that service. You can nest
--   <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any combination of dimension
--   filters. For more information, see <a>Expression</a>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt> operation requires that you
--   either group by or filter by a <tt>ResourceId</tt>. It requires the
--   <a>Expression</a> <tt>"SERVICE = Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud -
--   Compute"</tt> in the filter.
newGetCostAndUsageWithResources :: DateInterval -> Granularity -> Expression -> GetCostAndUsageWithResources

-- | You can group Amazon Web Services costs using up to two different
--   groups: <tt>DIMENSION</tt>, <tt>TAG</tt>, <tt>COST_CATEGORY</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_groupBy :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe Text)

-- | Which metrics are returned in the query. For more information about
--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking the units into account.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours vs. GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt>
--   requests.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_metrics :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe [Text])

-- | Sets the start and end dates for retrieving Amazon Web Services costs.
--   The range must be within the last 14 days (the start date cannot be
--   earlier than 14 days ago). The start date is inclusive, but the end
--   date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_timePeriod :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources DateInterval

-- | Sets the Amazon Web Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>,
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set,
--   the response object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>,
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>, <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_granularity :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources Granularity

-- | Filters Amazon Web Services costs by different dimensions. For
--   example, you can specify <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>
--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any
--   combination of dimension filters. For more information, see
--   <a>Expression</a>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt> operation requires that you
--   either group by or filter by a <tt>ResourceId</tt>. It requires the
--   <a>Expression</a> <tt>"SERVICE = Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud -
--   Compute"</tt> in the filter.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_filter :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources Expression

-- | Retrieves cost and usage metrics for your account. You can specify
--   which cost and usage-related metric that you want the request to
--   return. For example, you can specify <tt>BlendedCosts</tt> or
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>. You can also filter and group your data by
--   various dimensions, such as <tt>SERVICE</tt> or <tt>AZ</tt>, in a
--   specific time range. For a complete list of valid dimensions, see the
--   <a>GetDimensionValues</a> operation. Management account in an
--   organization in Organizations have access to all member accounts.
--   
--   For information about filter limitations, see <a>Quotas and
--   restrictions</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.GetCostAndUsage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCostAndUsage</a> smart constructor.
data GetCostAndUsage
GetCostAndUsage' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> DateInterval -> Granularity -> [Text] -> GetCostAndUsage

-- | You can group Amazon Web Services costs using up to two different
--   groups, either dimensions, tag keys, cost categories, or any two group
--   by types.
--   
--   Valid values for the <tt>DIMENSION</tt> type are <tt>AZ</tt>,
--   <tt>INSTANCE_TYPE</tt>, <tt>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</tt>,
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>, <tt>OPERATION</tt>, <tt>PLATFORM</tt>,
--   <tt>PURCHASE_TYPE</tt>, <tt>SERVICE</tt>, <tt>TENANCY</tt>,
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and <tt>USAGE_TYPE</tt>.
--   
--   When you group by the <tt>TAG</tt> type and include a valid tag key,
--   you get all tag values, including empty strings.
[$sel:groupBy:GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> Maybe [GroupDefinition]

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
[$sel:nextPageToken:GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> Maybe Text

-- | Filters Amazon Web Services costs by different dimensions. For
--   example, you can specify <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>
--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any
--   combination of dimension filters. For more information, see
--   <a>Expression</a>.
[$sel:filter':GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> Maybe Expression

-- | Sets the start date and end date for retrieving Amazon Web Services
--   costs. The start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
[$sel:timePeriod:GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> DateInterval

-- | Sets the Amazon Web Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set,
--   the response object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>, either
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
[$sel:granularity:GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> Granularity

-- | Which metrics are returned in the query. For more information about
--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking into account the units.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours and GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsage</tt> requests.
[$sel:metrics:GetCostAndUsage'] :: GetCostAndUsage -> [Text]

-- | Retrieves all of the cost anomalies detected on your account during
--   the time period that's specified by the <tt>DateInterval</tt> object.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAnomalies</a> smart constructor.
data GetAnomalies
GetAnomalies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TotalImpactFilter -> Maybe Int -> Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType -> Maybe Text -> AnomalyDateInterval -> GetAnomalies

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.

-- | Filters anomaly results by the total impact field on the anomaly
--   object. For example, you can filter anomalies <tt>GREATER_THAN
--   200.00</tt> to retrieve anomalies, with an estimated dollar impact
--   greater than 200.
[$sel:totalImpact:GetAnomalies'] :: GetAnomalies -> Maybe TotalImpactFilter

-- | The number of entries a paginated response contains.
[$sel:maxResults:GetAnomalies'] :: GetAnomalies -> Maybe Int

-- | Filters anomaly results by the feedback field on the anomaly object.
[$sel:feedback:GetAnomalies'] :: GetAnomalies -> Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType

-- | Retrieves all of the cost anomalies detected for a specific cost
--   anomaly monitor Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
[$sel:monitorArn:GetAnomalies'] :: GetAnomalies -> Maybe Text

-- | Assigns the start and end dates for retrieving cost anomalies. The
--   returned anomaly object will have an <tt>AnomalyEndDate</tt> in the
--   specified time range.
[$sel:dateInterval:GetAnomalies'] :: GetAnomalies -> AnomalyDateInterval

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAnomalies</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

-- | Returns the name, ARN, rules, definition, and effective dates of a
--   Cost Category that's defined in the account.
--   
--   You have the option to use <tt>EffectiveOn</tt> to return a Cost
--   Category that is active on a specific date. If there is no
--   <tt>EffectiveOn</tt> specified, you’ll see a Cost Category that is
--   effective on the current date. If Cost Category is still effective,
--   <tt>EffectiveEnd</tt> is omitted in the response.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.DescribeCostCategoryDefinition

-- | Deletes a Cost Category. Expenses from this month going forward will
--   no longer be categorized with this Cost Category.

-- | Updates an existing cost anomaly monitor. The changes made are applied
--   going forward, and doesn'tt change anomalies detected in the past.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer.UpdateAnomalyMonitor

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAnomalyMonitor</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAnomalyMonitor
UpdateAnomalyMonitor' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateAnomalyMonitor

-- | The new name for the cost anomaly monitor.
[$sel:monitorName:UpdateAnomalyMonitor'] :: UpdateAnomalyMonitor -> Maybe Text

-- | Cost anomaly monitor Amazon Resource Names (ARNs).
[$sel:monitorArn:UpdateAnomalyMonitor'] :: UpdateAnomalyMonitor -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAnomalyMonitor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorName:UpdateAnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>updateAnomalyMonitor_monitorName</a> - The new name for the cost
--   anomaly monitor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:UpdateAnomalyMonitor'</a>,

-- | Updates an existing Cost Category. Changes made to the Cost Category
--   rules will be used to categorize the current month’s expenses and
--   future expenses. This won’t change categorization for the previous
--   months.
