module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Lens

-- | Groups only by <tt>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</tt>. Metadata is included.
getReservationUtilization_groupBy :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getReservationUtilization_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set, <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set. If
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response object doesn't include
--   <tt>Granularity</tt>, either <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>. If
--   both <tt>GroupBy</tt> and <tt>Granularity</tt> aren't set,
--   <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> defaults to <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getReservationUtilization_granularity :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe Granularity)

-- | Filters utilization data by dimensions. You can filter by the
--   following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>SERVICE</li>
--   <li>SCOPE</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension, and nesting is supported up to only one level
--   deep. If there are multiple values for a dimension, they are OR'd
--   together.
getReservationUtilization_filter :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe Expression)

-- | The maximum number of objects that you returned for this request. If
--   more objects are available, in the response, Amazon Web Services
--   provides a NextPageToken value that you can use in a subsequent call
--   to get the next batch of objects.
getReservationUtilization_maxResults :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe Natural)

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentageInUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PurchasedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PurchasedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalActualHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalActualUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetRISavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalPotentialRISavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedUpfrontFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedRecurringFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalAmortizedFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RICostForUnusedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RealizedSavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnrealizedSavings</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
getReservationUtilization_sortBy :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization (Maybe SortDefinition)

-- | Sets the start and end dates for retrieving RI utilization. The start
--   date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getReservationUtilization_timePeriod :: Lens' GetReservationUtilization DateInterval

-- | The token for the next set of retrievable results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getReservationUtilizationResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetReservationUtilizationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The total amount of time that you used your RIs.
getReservationUtilizationResponse_total :: Lens' GetReservationUtilizationResponse (Maybe ReservationAggregates)

-- | The response's http status code.
getReservationUtilizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetReservationUtilizationResponse Int

-- | The amount of time that you used your RIs.
getReservationUtilizationResponse_utilizationsByTime :: Lens' GetReservationUtilizationResponse [UtilizationByTime]

-- | You can group the data using the attributes <tt>INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>,
--   <tt>REGION</tt>, or <tt>SERVICE</tt>.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_groupBy :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The measurement that you want your Savings Plans coverage reported in.
--   The only valid value is <tt>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlans</tt>.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_metrics :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe [Text])

-- | The granularity of the Amazon Web Services cost data for your Savings
--   Plans. <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set if <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set.
--   
--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_granularity :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe Granularity)

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_nextToken :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe Text)

-- | Filters Savings Plans coverage data by dimensions. You can filter data
--   for Savings Plans usage with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension. If there are multiple values for a dimension,
--   they are OR'd together.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_filter :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe Expression)

-- | The number of items to be returned in a response. The default is
--   <tt>20</tt>, with a minimum value of <tt>1</tt>.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_maxResults :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe Natural)

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlan</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CoveragePercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>InstanceFamily</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Region</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Service</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_sortBy :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage (Maybe SortDefinition)

-- | The time period that you want the usage and costs for. The
--   <tt>Start</tt> date must be within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date
--   must be after the <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date.
--   Future dates can't be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.
getSavingsPlansCoverage_timePeriod :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverage DateInterval

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getSavingsPlansCoverageResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getSavingsPlansCoverageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverageResponse Int

-- | The amount of spend that your Savings Plans covered.
getSavingsPlansCoverageResponse_savingsPlansCoverages :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansCoverageResponse [SavingsPlansCoverage]

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getTags_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe Text)

-- | The value that you want to search for.
getTags_searchString :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe Text)

-- | The key of the tag that you want to return values for.
getTags_tagKey :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
getTags_filter :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe Expression)

-- | This field is only used when SortBy is provided in the request. The
--   maximum number of objects that to be returned for this request. If
--   MaxResults is not specified with SortBy, the request will return 1000
--   results as the default value for this parameter.
--   
--   For <tt>GetTags</tt>, MaxResults has an upper limit of 1000.
getTags_maxResults :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe Natural)

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The key represents cost and usage metrics. The following values are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>BlendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetAmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetUnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsageQuantity</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NormalizedUsageAmount</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   When using <tt>SortBy</tt>, <tt>NextPageToken</tt> and
--   <tt>SearchString</tt> are not supported.
getTags_sortBy :: Lens' GetTags (Maybe [SortDefinition])

-- | The start and end dates for retrieving the dimension values. The start
--   date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getTags_timePeriod :: Lens' GetTags DateInterval

-- | The token for the next set of retrievable results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getTagsResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetTagsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetTagsResponse Int

-- | The tags that match your request.
getTagsResponse_tags :: Lens' GetTagsResponse [Text]

-- | The number of query results that Amazon Web Services returns at a
--   time.
getTagsResponse_returnSize :: Lens' GetTagsResponse Int

-- | The total number of query results.
getTagsResponse_totalSize :: Lens' GetTagsResponse Int

-- | The pagination token that indicates the next set of results that you
--   want to retrieve.
getRightsizingRecommendation_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | Enables you to customize recommendations across two attributes. You
--   can choose to view recommendations for instances within the same
--   instance families or across different instance families. You can also
--   choose to view your estimated savings associated with recommendations
--   with consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or
--   neither.
getRightsizingRecommendation_configuration :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendation (Maybe RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration)

-- | Undocumented member.
getRightsizingRecommendation_filter :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendation (Maybe Expression)

-- | The number of recommendations that you want returned in a single
--   response object.
getRightsizingRecommendation_pageSize :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendation (Maybe Natural)

-- | The specific service that you want recommendations for. The only valid
--   value for <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> is
--   "<tt>AmazonEC2</tt>".
getRightsizingRecommendation_service :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendation Text

-- | Summary of this recommendation set.
getRightsizingRecommendationResponse_summary :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendationResponse (Maybe RightsizingRecommendationSummary)

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results.
getRightsizingRecommendationResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendationResponse (Maybe Text)

getRightsizingRecommendationResponse_metadata :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendationResponse (Maybe RightsizingRecommendationMetadata)

-- | Enables you to customize recommendations across two attributes. You
--   can choose to view recommendations for instances within the same

--   with consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or
--   neither.

getRightsizingRecommendationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRightsizingRecommendationResponse Int

-- | You can group Amazon Web Services costs using up to two different
--   groups: <tt>DIMENSION</tt>, <tt>TAG</tt>, <tt>COST_CATEGORY</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_groupBy :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe Text)

-- | Which metrics are returned in the query. For more information about
--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking the units into account.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours vs. GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt>
--   requests.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_metrics :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources (Maybe [Text])

-- | Sets the start and end dates for retrieving Amazon Web Services costs.
--   The range must be within the last 14 days (the start date cannot be
--   earlier than 14 days ago). The start date is inclusive, but the end
--   date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_timePeriod :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources DateInterval

-- | Sets the Amazon Web Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>,
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set,
--   the response object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>,
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt>, <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_granularity :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources Granularity

-- | Filters Amazon Web Services costs by different dimensions. For
--   example, you can specify <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>
--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any
--   combination of dimension filters. For more information, see
--   <a>Expression</a>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt> operation requires that you
--   either group by or filter by a <tt>ResourceId</tt>. It requires the
--   <a>Expression</a> <tt>"SERVICE = Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud -
--   Compute"</tt> in the filter.
getCostAndUsageWithResources_filter :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResources Expression

-- | The time period that is covered by the results in the response.
getCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse_resultsByTime :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse (Maybe [ResultByTime])

--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse (Maybe Text)

--   if the value is a linked account, the attribute is that account name.
getCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse_dimensionValueAttributes :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse (Maybe [DimensionValuesWithAttributes])

--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> parameters in the request.
getCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse_groupDefinitions :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The response's http status code.
getCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageWithResourcesResponse Int

-- | Cost Explorer always returns the mean forecast as a single point. You
--   can request a prediction interval around the mean by specifying a
--   confidence level. The higher the confidence level, the more confident
--   Cost Explorer is about the actual value falling in the prediction
--   interval. Higher confidence levels result in wider prediction
--   intervals.
getUsageForecast_predictionIntervalLevel :: Lens' GetUsageForecast (Maybe Natural)

-- | The filters that you want to use to filter your forecast. The
--   <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> API supports filtering by the following
--   dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>AZ</pre></li>

--   <li><pre>TENANCY</pre></li>

--   <li><pre>PLATFORM</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>DATABASE_ENGINE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>BILLING_ENTITY</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RESERVATION_ID</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>
getUsageForecast_filter :: Lens' GetUsageForecast (Maybe Expression)

-- | The start and end dates of the period that you want to retrieve usage
--   forecast for. The start date is inclusive, but the end date is
--   exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is
--   retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including
--   <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>. The start
--   date must be equal to or later than the current date to avoid a
--   validation error.
getUsageForecast_timePeriod :: Lens' GetUsageForecast DateInterval

-- | Which metric Cost Explorer uses to create your forecast.
--   
--   Valid values for a <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> call are the following:
--   
--   <ul>

--   <li>NORMALIZED_USAGE_AMOUNT</li>
--   </ul>

-- | How granular you want the forecast to be. You can get 3 months of
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12 months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetUsageForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getUsageForecast_granularity :: Lens' GetUsageForecast Granularity

-- | The forecasts for your query, in order. For <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts,
--   this is a list of days. For <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts, this is a list
--   of months.
getUsageForecastResponse_forecastResultsByTime :: Lens' GetUsageForecastResponse (Maybe [ForecastResult])

--

--   can use multiple values in a request.
getReservationCoverage_metrics :: Lens' GetReservationCoverage (Maybe [Text])

-- | The granularity of the Amazon Web Services cost data for the
--   reservation. Valid values are <tt>MONTHLY</tt> and <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set, <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set. If
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response object doesn't include
--   <tt>Granularity</tt>, either <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getReservationCoverage_granularity :: Lens' GetReservationCoverage (Maybe Granularity)

-- | Filters utilization data by dimensions. You can filter by the
--   following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>SERVICE</li>
--   <li>TAG</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a> object
--   as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported among each
--   dimension. You can nest only one level deep. If there are multiple
--   values for a dimension, they are OR'd together.
--   
--   If you don't provide a <tt>SERVICE</tt> filter, Cost Explorer defaults
--   to EC2.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
getReservationCoverage_filter :: Lens' GetReservationCoverage (Maybe Expression)

-- | The maximum number of objects that you returned for this request. If
--   more objects are available, in the response, Amazon Web Services
--   provides a NextPageToken value that you can use in a subsequent call
--   to get the next batch of objects.
getReservationCoverage_maxResults :: Lens' GetReservationCoverage (Maybe Natural)

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getDimensionValues_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The context for the call to <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>. This can be
--   <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt> or <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. The default value is
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. If the context is set to
--   <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, the resulting dimension values can be used in
--   the <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> operation. If the context is
--   set to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, the resulting dimension values can be
--   used in the <tt>GetCostAndUsage</tt> operation.
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE - The Amazon Relational Database Service database.
--   Examples are Aurora or MySQL.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME - The name of the organization that sells you
--   Amazon Web Services services, such as Amazon Web Services.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM - The operating system. Examples are Windows or
--   Linux.</li>
--   <li>OPERATION - The action performed. Examples include
--   <tt>RunInstance</tt> and <tt>CreateBucket</tt>.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>PURCHASE_TYPE - The reservation type of the purchase to which this
--   usage is related. Examples include On-Demand Instances and Standard
--   Reserved Instances.</li>
--   <li>SERVICE - The Amazon Web Services service such as Amazon
--   DynamoDB.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE - The type of usage. An example is
--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>
getDimensionValues_context :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe Context)

-- | The value that you want to search the filter values for.
getDimensionValues_searchString :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
getDimensionValues_filter :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe Expression)

-- | This field is only used when SortBy is provided in the request. The
--   maximum number of objects that to be returned for this request. If
--   MaxResults is not specified with SortBy, the request will return 1000
--   results as the default value for this parameter.
--   
--   For <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>, MaxResults has an upper limit of
--   1000.
getDimensionValues_maxResults :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe Natural)

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The key represents cost and usage metrics. The following values are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>BlendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetAmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetUnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsageQuantity</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NormalizedUsageAmount</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   When you specify a <tt>SortBy</tt> paramater, the context must be
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. Further, when using <tt>SortBy</tt>,
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> and <tt>SearchString</tt> are not supported.
getDimensionValues_sortBy :: Lens' GetDimensionValues (Maybe [SortDefinition])

-- | The start date and end date for retrieving the dimension values. The
--   start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For example,
--   if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getDimensionValues_timePeriod :: Lens' GetDimensionValues DateInterval

-- | The name of the dimension. Each <tt>Dimension</tt> is available for a
--   different <tt>Context</tt>. For more information, see
--   <tt>Context</tt>.
getDimensionValues_dimension :: Lens' GetDimensionValues Dimension

-- | The token for the next set of retrievable results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getDimensionValuesResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetDimensionValuesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getDimensionValuesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDimensionValuesResponse Int

-- | The filters that you used to filter your request. Some dimensions are
--   available only for a specific context.
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE - The Amazon Relational Database Service database.
--   Examples are Aurora or MySQL.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME - The name of the organization that sells you
--   Amazon Web Services services, such as Amazon Web Services.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM - The operating system. Examples are Windows or
--   Linux.</li>
--   <li>OPERATION - The action performed. Examples include
--   <tt>RunInstance</tt> and <tt>CreateBucket</tt>.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>PURCHASE_TYPE - The reservation type of the purchase to which this
--   usage is related. Examples include On-Demand Instances and Standard
--   Reserved Instances.</li>
--   <li>SERVICE - The Amazon Web Services service such as Amazon
--   DynamoDB.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE - The type of usage. An example is
--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>

-- | You can group Amazon Web Services costs using up to two different
--   groups, either dimensions, tag keys, cost categories, or any two group
--   by types.
--   
--   Valid values for the <tt>DIMENSION</tt> type are <tt>AZ</tt>,
--   <tt>INSTANCE_TYPE</tt>, <tt>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME</tt>,
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>, <tt>OPERATION</tt>, <tt>PLATFORM</tt>,
--   <tt>PURCHASE_TYPE</tt>, <tt>SERVICE</tt>, <tt>TENANCY</tt>,
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and <tt>USAGE_TYPE</tt>.
--   
--   When you group by the <tt>TAG</tt> type and include a valid tag key,
--   you get all tag values, including empty strings.
getCostAndUsage_groupBy :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getCostAndUsage_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage (Maybe Text)

-- | Filters Amazon Web Services costs by different dimensions. For
--   example, you can specify <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>
--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any
--   combination of dimension filters. For more information, see
--   <a>Expression</a>.
getCostAndUsage_filter :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage (Maybe Expression)

-- | Sets the start date and end date for retrieving Amazon Web Services
--   costs. The start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
getCostAndUsage_timePeriod :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage DateInterval

-- | Sets the Amazon Web Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set,
--   the response object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>, either
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
getCostAndUsage_granularity :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage Granularity

-- | Which metrics are returned in the query. For more information about
--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking into account the units.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours and GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsage</tt> requests.
getCostAndUsage_metrics :: Lens' GetCostAndUsage [Text]

-- | The time period that's covered by the results in the response.
getCostAndUsageResponse_resultsByTime :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageResponse (Maybe [ResultByTime])

-- | The token for the next set of retrievable results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getCostAndUsageResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The attributes that apply to a specific dimension value. For example,
--   if the value is a linked account, the attribute is that account name.
getCostAndUsageResponse_dimensionValueAttributes :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageResponse (Maybe [DimensionValuesWithAttributes])

-- | The groups that are specified by the <tt>Filter</tt> or
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> parameters in the request.
getCostAndUsageResponse_groupDefinitions :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageResponse (Maybe [GroupDefinition])

-- | The response's http status code.
getCostAndUsageResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetCostAndUsageResponse Int

-- | The token to retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe Text)

-- | The account scope that you want your recommendations for. Amazon Web
--   Services calculates recommendations including the management account
--   and member accounts if the value is set to <tt>PAYER</tt>. If the
--   value is <tt>LINKED</tt>, recommendations are calculated for
--   individual member accounts only.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_accountScope :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe AccountScope)

-- | You can filter your recommendations by Account ID with the
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> dimension. To filter your recommendations by
--   Account ID, specify <tt>Key</tt> as <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and
--   <tt>Value</tt> as the comma-separated Acount ID(s) for which you want
--   to see Savings Plans purchase recommendations.
--   
--   For GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation, the <tt>Filter</tt> does
--   not include <tt>CostCategories</tt> or <tt>Tags</tt>. It only includes
--   <tt>Dimensions</tt>. With <tt>Dimensions</tt>, <tt>Key</tt> must be
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and <tt>Value</tt> can be a single Account ID
--   or multiple comma-separated Account IDs for which you want to see
--   Savings Plans Purchase Recommendations. <tt>AND</tt> and <tt>OR</tt>
--   operators are not supported.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_filter :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe Expression)

-- | The number of recommendations that you want returned in a single
--   response object.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_pageSize :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe Natural)

-- | The Savings Plans recommendation type requested.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_savingsPlansType :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation SupportedSavingsPlansType

-- | The savings plan recommendation term used to generate these
--   recommendations.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_termInYears :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation TermInYears

-- | The payment option used to generate these recommendations.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_paymentOption :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation PaymentOption

-- | The lookback period used to generate the recommendation.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation LookbackPeriodInDays

-- | The token for the next set of retrievable results. Amazon Web Services
--   provides the token when the response from a previous call has more
--   results than the maximum page size.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains your request parameters, Savings Plan Recommendations
--   Summary, and Details.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse_savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse (Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation)

-- | Information regarding this specific recommendation set.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse_metadata :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse (Maybe SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationMetadata)

-- | The response's http status code.
getSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationResponse Int

-- | The granularity of the Amazon Web Services utillization data for your
--   Savings Plans.

--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
getSavingsPlansUtilization_granularity :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Granularity)

-- | Filters Savings Plans utilization coverage data for active Savings
--   Plans dimensions. You can filter data with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PAYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension.
getSavingsPlansUtilization_filter :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe Expression)

-- | The value by which you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetSavings</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
getSavingsPlansUtilization_sortBy :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansUtilization (Maybe SortDefinition)

-- | The time period that you want the usage and costs for. The
--   <tt>Start</tt> date must be within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date
--   must be after the <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date.
--   Future dates can't be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.
getSavingsPlansUtilization_timePeriod :: Lens' GetSavingsPlansUtilization DateInterval

--   that Cost Category value.

-- | Undocumented member.
costCategoryRule_value :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Text)

-- | An <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
costCategoryRule_rule :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe Expression)

-- | You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
costCategoryRule_type :: Lens' CostCategoryRule (Maybe CostCategoryRuleType)

-- | The parameters for a split charge method. This is only required for
--   the <tt>FIXED</tt> method.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter))

-- | The Cost Category value that you want to split. That value can't be
--   used as a source or a target in other split charge rules. To indicate
--   uncategorized costs, you can use an empty string as the source.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_source :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule Text

-- | The Cost Category values that you want to split costs across. These
--   values can't be used as a source in other split charge rules.
costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The method that's used to define how to split your source costs across
--   your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
costCategorySplitChargeRule_method :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRule CostCategorySplitChargeMethod

-- | The parameter type.
costCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter_type :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameterType

-- | The parameter values.
costCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter_values :: Lens' CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
dateInterval_start :: Lens' DateInterval Text

-- | The end of the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
dateInterval_end :: Lens' DateInterval Text

savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation_lookbackPeriodInDays :: Lens' SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendation (Maybe LookbackPeriodInDays)

--   <tt>estimatedSavingsAmount</tt>/ <tt>estimatedSPCost</tt>*100.

module Amazonka.CostExplorer.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2017-10-25</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   You can use the Cost Explorer API to programmatically query your cost
--   and usage data. You can query for aggregated data such as total
--   monthly costs or total daily usage. You can also query for granular
--   data. This might include the number of daily write operations for
--   Amazon DynamoDB database tables in your production environment.
--   
--   Service Endpoint
--   
--   The Cost Explorer API provides the following endpoint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>https://ce.us-east-1.amazonaws.com</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For information about the costs that are associated with the Cost
--   Explorer API, see <a>Amazon Web Services Cost Management Pricing</a>.
module Amazonka.CostExplorer

-- | API version <tt>2017-10-25</tt> of the Amazon Cost Explorer Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The cost anomaly subscription does not exist for the account.
_UnknownSubscriptionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested report expired. Update the date interval and try again.
_BillExpirationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your request parameters changed between pages. Try again with the old
--   parameters or without a pagination token.
_RequestChangedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Cost Explorer was unable to identify the usage unit. Provide
--   <tt>UsageType/UsageTypeGroup</tt> filter selections that contain
--   matching units, for example: <tt>hours</tt>.
_UnresolvableUsageUnitException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've reached the limit on the number of resources you can create, or
--   exceeded the size of an individual resource.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The pagination token is invalid. Try again without a pagination token.
_InvalidNextTokenException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested data is unavailable.
_DataUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The cost anomaly monitor does not exist for the account.
_UnknownMonitorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified ARN in the request doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You made too many calls in a short period of time. Try again later.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetReservationUtilization</a> smart constructor.
data GetReservationUtilization
GetReservationUtilization' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Granularity -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetReservationUtilization

-- | Create a value of <a>GetReservationUtilization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_groupBy</a> - Groups only by
--   <tt>SUBSCRIPTION_ID</tt>. Metadata is included.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_nextPageToken</a> - The token to retrieve
--   the next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the token when
--   the response from a previous call has more results than the maximum
--   page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_granularity</a> - If <tt>GroupBy</tt> is
--   set, <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't
--   set, the response object doesn't include <tt>Granularity</tt>, either
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>. If both <tt>GroupBy</tt> and
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> aren't set, <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt>
--   defaults to <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_filter</a> - Filters utilization data by
--   dimensions. You can filter by the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>SERVICE</li>
--   <li>SCOPE</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension, and nesting is supported up to only one level
--   deep. If there are multiple values for a dimension, they are OR'd
--   together.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   objects that you returned for this request. If more objects are
--   available, in the response, Amazon Web Services provides a
--   NextPageToken value that you can use in a subsequent call to get the
--   next batch of objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_sortBy</a> - The value by which you want
--   to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentageInUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PurchasedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PurchasedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalActualHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalActualUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCostOfRIHoursUsed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetRISavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalPotentialRISavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedUpfrontFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedRecurringFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalAmortizedFee</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RICostForUnusedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>RealizedSavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnrealizedSavings</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetReservationUtilization'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationUtilization_timePeriod</a> - Sets the start and end
--   dates for retrieving RI utilization. The start date is inclusive, but
--   the end date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
newGetReservationUtilization :: DateInterval -> GetReservationUtilization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSavingsPlansCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data GetSavingsPlansCoverage
GetSavingsPlansCoverage' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Granularity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetSavingsPlansCoverage

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_groupBy</a> - You can group the data using
--   the attributes <tt>INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>, <tt>REGION</tt>, or
--   <tt>SERVICE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_metrics</a> - The measurement that you want
--   your Savings Plans coverage reported in. The only valid value is
--   <tt>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlans</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_granularity</a> - The granularity of the
--   Amazon Web Services cost data for your Savings Plans.
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set if <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set.
--   
--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_nextToken</a> - The token to retrieve the
--   next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the token when the
--   response from a previous call has more results than the maximum page
--   size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_filter</a> - Filters Savings Plans coverage
--   data by dimensions. You can filter data for Savings Plans usage with
--   the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SERVICE</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>INSTANCE_FAMILY</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a>
--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension. If there are multiple values for a dimension,
--   they are OR'd together.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_maxResults</a> - The number of items to be
--   returned in a response. The default is <tt>20</tt>, with a minimum
--   value of <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_sortBy</a> - The value by which you want to
--   sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>SpendCoveredBySavingsPlan</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CoveragePercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>InstanceFamily</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Region</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Service</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetSavingsPlansCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansCoverage_timePeriod</a> - The time period that you
--   want the usage and costs for. The <tt>Start</tt> date must be within
--   13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date must be after the <tt>Start</tt>
--   date, and before the current date. Future dates can't be used as an
--   <tt>End</tt> date.
newGetSavingsPlansCoverage :: DateInterval -> GetSavingsPlansCoverage

--

--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_groupBy</a> - You can group Amazon Web
--   Services costs using up to two different groups: <tt>DIMENSION</tt>,
--   <tt>TAG</tt>, <tt>COST_CATEGORY</tt>.

--   retrieve the next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the
--   token when the response from a previous call has more results than the
--   maximum page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_metrics</a> - Which metrics are
--   returned in the query. For more information about blended and
--   unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation appear on
--   some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking the units into account.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours vs. GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,
--   filter by <tt>UsageType</tt> or <tt>UsageTypeGroups</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> is required for <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt>
--   requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_timePeriod</a> - Sets the start and
--   end dates for retrieving Amazon Web Services costs. The range must be
--   within the last 14 days (the start date cannot be earlier than 14 days
--   ago). The start date is inclusive, but the end date is exclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the cost and usage data is retrieved from
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not
--   including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_granularity</a> - Sets the Amazon Web
--   Services cost granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt>, <tt>DAILY</tt>, or
--   <tt>HOURLY</tt>. If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response
--   object doesn't include the <tt>Granularity</tt>, <tt>MONTHLY</tt>,
--   <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetCostAndUsageWithResources'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsageWithResources_filter</a> - Filters Amazon Web
--   Services costs by different dimensions. For example, you can specify
--   <tt>SERVICE</tt> and <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt> and get the costs that
--   are associated with that account's usage of that service. You can nest
--   <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any combination of dimension
--   filters. For more information, see <a>Expression</a>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostAndUsageWithResources</tt> operation requires that you
--   either group by or filter by a <tt>ResourceId</tt>. It requires the
--   <a>Expression</a> <tt>"SERVICE = Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud -
--   Compute"</tt> in the filter.

-- | You can use the following request parameters to query for how much of
--   your instance usage a reservation covered.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetReservationCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data GetReservationCoverage
GetReservationCoverage' :: Maybe [GroupDefinition] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Granularity -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe SortDefinition -> DateInterval -> GetReservationCoverage

-- | Create a value of <a>GetReservationCoverage</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_groupBy</a> - You can group the data by the
--   following attributes:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_nextPageToken</a> - The token to retrieve
--   the next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the token when
--   the response from a previous call has more results than the maximum
--   page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_metrics</a> - The measurement that you want
--   your reservation coverage reported in.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>Hour</tt>, <tt>Unit</tt>, and <tt>Cost</tt>. You
--   can use multiple values in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_granularity</a> - The granularity of the
--   Amazon Web Services cost data for the reservation. Valid values are
--   <tt>MONTHLY</tt> and <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>GroupBy</tt> is set, <tt>Granularity</tt> can't be set. If
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response object doesn't include
--   <tt>Granularity</tt>, either <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>.
--   
--   The <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_filter</a> - Filters utilization data by
--   dimensions. You can filter by the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM</li>
--   <li>REGION</li>
--   <li>SERVICE</li>
--   <li>TAG</li>
--   <li>TENANCY</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <tt>GetReservationCoverage</tt> uses the same <a>Expression</a> object
--   as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported among each
--   dimension. You can nest only one level deep. If there are multiple
--   values for a dimension, they are OR'd together.
--   
--   If you don't provide a <tt>SERVICE</tt> filter, Cost Explorer defaults
--   to EC2.
--   
--   Cost category is also supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   objects that you returned for this request. If more objects are
--   available, in the response, Amazon Web Services provides a
--   NextPageToken value that you can use in a subsequent call to get the
--   next batch of objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_sortBy</a> - The value by which you want to
--   sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CoverageHoursPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ReservedHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalRunningHours</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CoverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>OnDemandNormalizedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>ReservedNormalizedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalRunningNormalizedUnits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Time</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetReservationCoverage'</a>,
--   <a>getReservationCoverage_timePeriod</a> - The start and end dates of
--   the period that you want to retrieve data about reservation coverage
--   for. You can retrieve data for a maximum of 13 months: the last 12
--   months and the current month. The start date is inclusive, but the end
--   date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
newGetReservationCoverage :: DateInterval -> GetReservationCoverage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetReservationCoverageResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCostForecast</a> with all optional fields

--   prediction interval around the mean by specifying a confidence level.
--   The higher the confidence level, the more confident Cost Explorer is
--   about the actual value falling in the prediction interval. Higher
--   confidence levels result in wider prediction intervals.

--   forecast to be. You can get 3 months of <tt>DAILY</tt> forecasts or 12
--   months of <tt>MONTHLY</tt> forecasts.
--   
--   The <tt>GetCostForecast</tt> operation supports only <tt>DAILY</tt>
--   and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDimensionValues</a> smart constructor.
data GetDimensionValues
GetDimensionValues' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Context -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [SortDefinition] -> DateInterval -> Dimension -> GetDimensionValues

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDimensionValues</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_nextPageToken</a> - The token to retrieve the
--   next set of results. Amazon Web Services provides the token when the
--   response from a previous call has more results than the maximum page
--   size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:context:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_context</a> - The context for the call to
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>. This can be <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt> or
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. The default value is <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>.
--   If the context is set to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, the resulting
--   dimension values can be used in the <tt>GetReservationUtilization</tt>
--   operation. If the context is set to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, the
--   resulting dimension values can be used in the <tt>GetCostAndUsage</tt>
--   operation.
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>DATABASE_ENGINE - The Amazon Relational Database Service database.
--   Examples are Aurora or MySQL.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LEGAL_ENTITY_NAME - The name of the organization that sells you
--   Amazon Web Services services, such as Amazon Web Services.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>OPERATING_SYSTEM - The operating system. Examples are Windows or
--   Linux.</li>
--   <li>OPERATION - The action performed. Examples include
--   <tt>RunInstance</tt> and <tt>CreateBucket</tt>.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>PURCHASE_TYPE - The reservation type of the purchase to which this
--   usage is related. Examples include On-Demand Instances and Standard
--   Reserved Instances.</li>
--   <li>SERVICE - The Amazon Web Services service such as Amazon
--   DynamoDB.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE - The type of usage. An example is
--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:searchString:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_searchString</a> - The value that you want to
--   search the filter values for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_filter</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_maxResults</a> - This field is only used when
--   SortBy is provided in the request. The maximum number of objects that
--   to be returned for this request. If MaxResults is not specified with
--   SortBy, the request will return 1000 results as the default value for
--   this parameter.
--   
--   For <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt>, MaxResults has an upper limit of
--   1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_sortBy</a> - The value by which you want to sort
--   the data.
--   
--   The key represents cost and usage metrics. The following values are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>BlendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetAmortizedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetUnblendedCost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsageQuantity</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NormalizedUsageAmount</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   When you specify a <tt>SortBy</tt> paramater, the context must be
--   <tt>COST_AND_USAGE</tt>. Further, when using <tt>SortBy</tt>,
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> and <tt>SearchString</tt> are not supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_timePeriod</a> - The start date and end date for
--   retrieving the dimension values. The start date is inclusive, but the
--   end date is exclusive. For example, if <tt>start</tt> is
--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimension:GetDimensionValues'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValues_dimension</a> - The name of the dimension. Each
--   <tt>Dimension</tt> is available for a different <tt>Context</tt>. For
--   more information, see <tt>Context</tt>.

--   DataTransfer-In-Bytes. The response for the
--   <tt>GetDimensionValues</tt> operation includes a unit attribute.
--   Examples include GB and Hrs.</li>
--   <li>USAGE_TYPE_GROUP - The grouping of common usage types. An example
--   is Amazon EC2: CloudWatch – Alarms. The response for this operation
--   includes a unit attribute.</li>
--   <li>RECORD_TYPE - The different types of charges such as RI fees,
--   usage costs, tax refunds, and credits.</li>
--   <li>RESOURCE_ID - The unique identifier of the resource. ResourceId is
--   an opt-in feature only available for last 14 days for EC2-Compute
--   Service.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>RESERVATIONS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AZ - The Availability Zone. An example is
--   <tt>us-east-1a</tt>.</li>
--   <li>CACHE_ENGINE - The Amazon ElastiCache operating system. Examples
--   are Windows or Linux.</li>
--   <li>DEPLOYMENT_OPTION - The scope of Amazon Relational Database
--   Service deployments. Valid values are <tt>SingleAZ</tt> and
--   <tt>MultiAZ</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE - The type of Amazon EC2 instance. An example is
--   <tt>m4.xlarge</tt>.</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>PLATFORM - The Amazon EC2 operating system. Examples are Windows
--   or Linux.</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>SCOPE (Utilization only) - The scope of a Reserved Instance (RI).
--   Values are regional or a single Availability Zone.</li>
--   <li>TAG (Coverage only) - The tags that are associated with a Reserved
--   Instance (RI).</li>
--   <li>TENANCY - The tenancy of a resource. Examples are shared or
--   dedicated.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you set the context to <tt>SAVINGS_PLANS</tt>, you can use the
--   following dimensions for searching:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLANS_TYPE - Type of Savings Plans (EC2 Instance or
--   Compute)</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_OPTION - Payment option for the given Savings Plans (for
--   example, All Upfront)</li>
--   <li>REGION - The Amazon Web Services Region.</li>
--   <li>INSTANCE_TYPE_FAMILY - The family of instances (For example,
--   <tt>m5</tt>)</li>
--   <li>LINKED_ACCOUNT - The description in the attribute map that
--   includes the full name of the member account. The value field contains
--   the Amazon Web Services ID of the member account.</li>
--   <li>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN - The unique identifier for your Savings
--   Plan</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:returnSize:GetDimensionValuesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValuesResponse_returnSize</a> - The number of results
--   that Amazon Web Services returned at one time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalSize:GetDimensionValuesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionValuesResponse_totalSize</a> - The total number of
--   search results.
newGetDimensionValuesResponse :: Int -> Int -> Int -> GetDimensionValuesResponse

--   and get the costs that are associated with that account's usage of
--   that service. You can nest <tt>Expression</tt> objects to define any

--   <tt>2017-01-01</tt> and <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, then the
--   cost and usage data is retrieved from <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to and
--   including <tt>2017-04-30</tt> but not including <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:granularity:GetCostAndUsage'</a>,
--   <a>getCostAndUsage_granularity</a> - Sets the Amazon Web Services cost
--   granularity to <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>, or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.
--   If <tt>Granularity</tt> isn't set, the response object doesn't include
--   the <tt>Granularity</tt>, either <tt>MONTHLY</tt> or <tt>DAILY</tt>,
--   or <tt>HOURLY</tt>.

--   <a>$sel:metrics:GetCostAndUsage'</a>, <a>getCostAndUsage_metrics</a> -
