--   blended and unblended rates, see <a>Why does the "blended" annotation
--   appear on some line items in my bill?</a>.
--   
--   Valid values are <tt>AmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>BlendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NetAmortizedCost</tt>, <tt>NetUnblendedCost</tt>,
--   <tt>NormalizedUsageAmount</tt>, <tt>UnblendedCost</tt>, and
--   <tt>UsageQuantity</tt>.
--   
--   If you return the <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metric, the service
--   aggregates all usage numbers without taking into account the units.
--   For example, if you aggregate <tt>usageQuantity</tt> across all of
--   Amazon EC2, the results aren't meaningful because Amazon EC2 compute
--   hours and data transfer are measured in different units (for example,
--   hours and GB). To get more meaningful <tt>UsageQuantity</tt> metrics,

--   The <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilization</tt> operation supports only
--   <tt>DAILY</tt> and <tt>MONTHLY</tt> granularities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,

--   utilization coverage data for active Savings Plans dimensions. You can
--   filter data with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>

--   object as the other operations, but only <tt>AND</tt> is supported
--   among each dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansUtilization'</a>,

--   to sort the data.

--

--   <li><pre>TotalCommitment</pre></li>

--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.

--   you want the usage and costs for. The <tt>Start</tt> date must be
--   within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date must be after the
--   <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date. Future dates can't
--   be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.

--   token when the response from a previous call has more results than the
--   maximum page size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataType:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails_dataType</a> - The data type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails_filter</a> - Filters Savings
--   Plans utilization coverage data for active Savings Plans dimensions.
--   You can filter data with the following dimensions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>LINKED_ACCOUNT</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SAVINGS_PLAN_ARN</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>REGION</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>PAYMENT_OPTION</pre></li>

--   </ul>

--   <tt>GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails</tt> uses the same
--   <a>Expression</a> object as the other operations, but only
--   <tt>AND</tt> is supported among each dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails_maxResults</a> - The number of
--   items to be returned in a response. The default is <tt>20</tt>, with a
--   minimum value of <tt>1</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sortBy:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails_sortBy</a> - The value by which
--   you want to sort the data.
--   
--   The following values are supported for <tt>Key</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>UtilizationPercentage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TotalCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UsedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>UnusedCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NetSavings</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedRecurringCommitment</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AmortizedUpfrontCommitment</pre></li>
--   </ul>

--   Supported values for <tt>SortOrder</tt> are <tt>ASCENDING</tt> or
--   <tt>DESCENDING</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timePeriod:GetSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getSavingsPlansUtilizationDetails_timePeriod</a> - The time period
--   that you want the usage and costs for. The <tt>Start</tt> date must be
--   within 13 months. The <tt>End</tt> date must be after the
--   <tt>Start</tt> date, and before the current date. Future dates can't
--   be used as an <tt>End</tt> date.

-- | An unusual cost pattern. This consists of the detailed metadata and
--   the current status of the anomaly object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomaly</a> smart constructor.
data Anomaly
Anomaly' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [RootCause] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnomalyFeedbackType -> Text -> AnomalyScore -> Impact -> Text -> Anomaly

-- | Create a value of <a>Anomaly</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyStartDate:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyStartDate</a>
--   - The first day the anomaly is detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValue:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_dimensionValue</a> -
--   The dimension for the anomaly (for example, an Amazon Web Services
--   service in a service monitor).
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootCauses:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_rootCauses</a> - The list
--   of identified root causes for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyEndDate:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyEndDate</a> -
--   The last day the anomaly is detected.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedback:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_feedback</a> - The feedback
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyId:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyId</a> - The unique
--   identifier for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:anomalyScore:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_anomalyScore</a> - The
--   latest and maximum score for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:impact:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_impact</a> - The dollar impact
--   for the anomaly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:Anomaly'</a>, <a>anomaly_monitorArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cost monitor that generated this
--   anomaly.
newAnomaly :: Text -> AnomalyScore -> Impact -> Text -> Anomaly

-- | The time period for an anomaly.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyDateInterval</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyDateInterval
AnomalyDateInterval' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> AnomalyDateInterval

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyDateInterval</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:AnomalyDateInterval'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyDateInterval_endDate</a> - The last date an anomaly was
--   observed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:AnomalyDateInterval'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyDateInterval_startDate</a> - The first date an anomaly was
--   observed.
newAnomalyDateInterval :: Text -> AnomalyDateInterval

-- | This object continuously inspects your account's cost data for
--   anomalies. It's based on <tt>MonitorType</tt> and
--   <tt>MonitorSpecification</tt>. The content consists of detailed
--   metadata and the current status of the monitor object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyMonitor</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyMonitor
AnomalyMonitor' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe MonitorDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyMonitor</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionalValueCount:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_dimensionalValueCount</a> - The value for evaluated
--   dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorSpecification:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorSpecification</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorDimension:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorDimension</a> - The dimensions to evaluate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_creationDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastUpdatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor was
--   last updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastEvaluatedDate:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_lastEvaluatedDate</a> - The date when the monitor
--   last evaluated for anomalies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArn:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorName:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorName</a> - The name of the monitor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorType:AnomalyMonitor'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyMonitor_monitorType</a> - The possible type values.
newAnomalyMonitor :: Text -> MonitorType -> AnomalyMonitor

-- | Quantifies the anomaly. The higher score means that it's more
--   anomalous.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalyScore</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalyScore
AnomalyScore' :: Double -> Double -> AnomalyScore

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalyScore</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxScore:AnomalyScore'</a>, <a>anomalyScore_maxScore</a> - The
--   maximum score that's observed during the <tt>AnomalyDateInterval</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentScore:AnomalyScore'</a>,
--   <a>anomalyScore_currentScore</a> - The last observed score.
newAnomalyScore :: Double -> Double -> AnomalyScore

-- | The association between a monitor, threshold, and list of subscribers
--   used to deliver notifications about anomalies detected by a monitor
--   that exceeds a threshold. The content consists of the detailed
--   metadata and the current status of the <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt>
--   object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnomalySubscription</a> smart constructor.
data AnomalySubscription
AnomalySubscription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> [Text] -> [Subscriber] -> Double -> AnomalySubscriptionFrequency -> Text -> AnomalySubscription

-- | Create a value of <a>AnomalySubscription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_accountId</a> - Your unique account identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionArn:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscriptionArn</a> - The
--   <tt>AnomalySubscription</tt> Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitorArnList:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_monitorArnList</a> - A list of cost anomaly
--   monitors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscribers:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscribers</a> - A list of subscribers to
--   notify.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_threshold</a> - The dollar value that triggers
--   a notification if the threshold is exceeded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:frequency:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_frequency</a> - The frequency that anomaly
--   reports are sent over email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionName:AnomalySubscription'</a>,
--   <a>anomalySubscription_subscriptionName</a> - The name for the
--   subscription.
newAnomalySubscription :: Double -> AnomalySubscriptionFrequency -> Text -> AnomalySubscription

-- | The structure of Cost Categories. This includes detailed metadata and
--   the set of rules for the <tt>CostCategory</tt> object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategory</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategory
CostCategory' :: Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRule) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategory</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingStatus:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_processingStatus</a> - The list of processing statuses
--   for Cost Management products for a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveEnd</a> - The effective end data of your Cost
--   Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:splitChargeRules:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_splitChargeRules</a> - The split charge rules that are
--   used to allocate your charges between your Cost Category values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_defaultValue</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_costCategoryArn</a> - The unique identifier for your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategory'</a>,
--   <a>costCategory_effectiveStart</a> - The effective state data of your
--   Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_name</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ruleVersion:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_ruleVersion</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:CostCategory'</a>, <a>costCategory_rules</a> - The rules
--   are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match the
--   line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that Cost
--   Category value.
newCostCategory :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CostCategoryRuleVersion -> NonEmpty CostCategoryRule -> CostCategory

-- | When creating or updating a cost category, you can define the
--   <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. This
--   rule type adds the flexibility of defining a rule that dynamically
--   inherits the cost category value from the dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs that are based on the value of a specific
--   tag key, first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the
--   tag dimension and specify the tag key to use.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension
CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimensionName -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionName</a> - The name of
--   the dimension that's used to group costs.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>, the cost category value
--   is based on account name. If you specify <tt>TAG</tt>, the cost
--   category value will be based on the value of the specified tag key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionKey:CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryInheritedValueDimension_dimensionKey</a> - The key to
--   extract cost category values.
newCostCategoryInheritedValueDimension :: CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension

-- | The list of processing statuses for Cost Management products for a
--   specific cost category.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryProcessingStatus</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryProcessingStatus
CostCategoryProcessingStatus' :: Maybe CostCategoryStatus -> Maybe CostCategoryStatusComponent -> CostCategoryProcessingStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryProcessingStatus</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CostCategoryProcessingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryProcessingStatus_status</a> - The process status for a
--   specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:component:CostCategoryProcessingStatus'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryProcessingStatus_component</a> - The Cost Management
--   product name of the applied status.
newCostCategoryProcessingStatus :: CostCategoryProcessingStatus

-- | A reference to a Cost Category containing only enough information to
--   identify the Cost Category.
--   
--   You can use this information to retrieve the full Cost Category
--   information using <tt>DescribeCostCategory</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryReference</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryReference
CostCategoryReference' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CostCategoryProcessingStatus] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CostCategoryReference

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryReference</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveStart:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_effectiveStart</a> - The Cost Category's
--   effective start date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_values</a> - A list of unique cost category
--   values in a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategoryArn:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_costCategoryArn</a> - The unique identifier
--   for your Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:processingStatus:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_processingStatus</a> - The list of processing
--   statuses for Cost Management products for a specific cost category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfRules:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_numberOfRules</a> - The number of rules that
--   are associated with a specific Cost Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_name</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:effectiveEnd:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_effectiveEnd</a> - The Cost Category's
--   effective end date.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:CostCategoryReference'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryReference_defaultValue</a> - Undocumented member.
newCostCategoryReference :: CostCategoryReference

-- | Rules are processed in order. If there are multiple rules that match
--   the line item, then the first rule to match is used to determine that
--   Cost Category value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryRule
CostCategoryRule' :: Maybe CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Expression -> Maybe CostCategoryRuleType -> CostCategoryRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inheritedValue:CostCategoryRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryRule_inheritedValue</a> - The value the line item is
--   categorized as if the line item contains the matched dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_value</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rule:CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_rule</a> - An
--   <a>Expression</a> object used to categorize costs. This supports
--   dimensions, tags, and nested expressions. Currently the only
--   dimensions supported are <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>SERVICE_CODE</tt>, <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt>, and
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME</tt>.
--   
--   Root level <tt>OR</tt> isn't supported. We recommend that you create a
--   separate rule instead.
--   
--   <tt>RECORD_TYPE</tt> is a dimension used for Cost Explorer APIs, and
--   is also supported for Cost Category expressions. This dimension uses
--   different terms, depending on whether you're using the console or
--   API/JSON editor. For a detailed comparison, see <a>Term
--   Comparisons</a> in the <i>Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CostCategoryRule'</a>, <a>costCategoryRule_type</a> -
--   You can define the <tt>CostCategoryRule</tt> rule type as either
--   <tt>REGULAR</tt> or <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt>. The
--   <tt>INHERITED_VALUE</tt> rule type adds the flexibility of defining a
--   rule that dynamically inherits the cost category value from the
--   dimension value defined by
--   <tt>CostCategoryInheritedValueDimension</tt>. For example, if you want
--   to dynamically group costs based on the value of a specific tag key,
--   first choose an inherited value rule type, then choose the tag
--   dimension and specify the tag key to use.
newCostCategoryRule :: CostCategoryRule

-- | Use the split charge rule to split the cost of one Cost Category value
--   across several other target values.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategorySplitChargeRule
CostCategorySplitChargeRule' :: Maybe (NonEmpty CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter) -> Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategorySplitChargeRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parameters:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_parameters</a> - The parameters for a
--   split charge method. This is only required for the <tt>FIXED</tt>
--   method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:source:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_source</a> - The Cost Category value
--   that you want to split. That value can't be used as a source or a
--   target in other split charge rules. To indicate uncategorized costs,
--   you can use an empty string as the source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targets:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_targets</a> - The Cost Category values
--   that you want to split costs across. These values can't be used as a
--   source in other split charge rules.
--   
--   <a>$sel:method:CostCategorySplitChargeRule'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRule_method</a> - The method that's used to
--   define how to split your source costs across your targets.
--   
--   <tt>Proportional</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on
--   the proportional weighted cost of each target.
--   
--   <tt>Fixed</tt> - Allocates charges across your targets based on your
--   defined allocation percentage.
--   
--   <pre>
--   @Even@ - Allocates costs evenly across all targets.
--   </pre>
newCostCategorySplitChargeRule :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeMethod -> CostCategorySplitChargeRule

-- | The parameters for a split charge method.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter
CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter' :: CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameterType -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter_type</a> - The parameter type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter'</a>,
--   <a>costCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter_values</a> - The parameter
--   values.
newCostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter :: CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameterType -> NonEmpty Text -> CostCategorySplitChargeRuleParameter

-- | The Cost Categories values used for filtering the costs.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> are not specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all Cost
--   Categories. That is, it filters on resources that aren't mapped to any
--   Cost Categories.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the Cost Categories
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it filters on resources without the given
--   Cost Categories key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCostCategoryValues</a> smart constructor.
data CostCategoryValues
CostCategoryValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> CostCategoryValues

-- | Create a value of <a>CostCategoryValues</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:CostCategoryValues'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryValues_values</a> - The specific value of the Cost
--   Category.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:CostCategoryValues'</a>, <a>costCategoryValues_key</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:CostCategoryValues'</a>,
--   <a>costCategoryValues_matchOptions</a> - The match options that you
--   can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for
--   actions related to cost category. The default values for
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newCostCategoryValues :: CostCategoryValues

-- | The amount of instance usage that a reservation covered.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverage</a> smart constructor.
data Coverage
Coverage' :: Maybe CoverageNormalizedUnits -> Maybe CoverageHours -> Maybe CoverageCost -> Coverage

-- | Create a value of <a>Coverage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageNormalizedUnits:Coverage'</a>,
--   <a>coverage_coverageNormalizedUnits</a> - The amount of instance usage
--   that the reservation covered, in normalized units.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageHours:Coverage'</a>, <a>coverage_coverageHours</a> -
--   The amount of instance usage that the reservation covered, in hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageCost:Coverage'</a>, <a>coverage_coverageCost</a> - The
--   amount of cost that the reservation covered.
newCoverage :: Coverage

-- | Reservation coverage for a specified period, in hours.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageByTime</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageByTime

-- | Create a value of <a>CoverageByTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   groups of instances that the reservation covered.

--   <a>coverageByTime_timePeriod</a> - The period that this coverage was
--   used over.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:CoverageByTime'</a>, <a>coverageByTime_total</a> - The
--   total reservation coverage, in hours.
newCoverageByTime :: CoverageByTime

-- | How long a running instance either used a reservation or was
--   On-Demand.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageHours</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageHours
CoverageHours' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CoverageHours

-- | Create a value of <a>CoverageHours</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageHoursPercentage:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_coverageHoursPercentage</a> - The percentage of
--   instance hours that a reservation covered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_onDemandHours</a> - The number of instance running
--   hours that On-Demand Instances covered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_totalRunningHours</a> - The total instance usage, in
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedHours:CoverageHours'</a>,
--   <a>coverageHours_reservedHours</a> - The number of instance running
--   hours that reservations covered.
newCoverageHours :: CoverageHours

-- | The amount of instance usage, in normalized units. You can use
--   normalized units to see your EC2 usage for multiple sizes of instances
--   in a uniform way. For example, suppose that you run an xlarge instance
--   and a 2xlarge instance. If you run both instances for the same amount
--   of time, the 2xlarge instance uses twice as much of your reservation
--   as the xlarge instance, even though both instances show only one
--   instance-hour. When you use normalized units instead of
--   instance-hours, the xlarge instance used 8 normalized units, and the
--   2xlarge instance used 16 normalized units.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Modifying Reserved Instances</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Linux Instances</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCoverageNormalizedUnits</a> smart constructor.
data CoverageNormalizedUnits
CoverageNormalizedUnits' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | Create a value of <a>CoverageNormalizedUnits</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservedNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_reservedNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that a reservation covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_totalRunningNormalizedUnits</a> - The total
--   number of normalized units that you used.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_coverageNormalizedUnitsPercentage</a> - The
--   percentage of your used instance normalized units that a reservation
--   covers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandNormalizedUnits:CoverageNormalizedUnits'</a>,
--   <a>coverageNormalizedUnits_onDemandNormalizedUnits</a> - The number of
--   normalized units that are covered by On-Demand Instances instead of a
--   reservation.
newCoverageNormalizedUnits :: CoverageNormalizedUnits

-- | Context about the current instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentInstance</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentInstance
CurrentInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceUtilization -> Maybe ResourceDetails -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TagValues] -> CurrentInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceId</a> - Resource ID of the current
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currencyCode:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_currencyCode</a> - The currency code that Amazon
--   Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceUtilization:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceUtilization</a> - Utilization information
--   of the current instance during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceDetails:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_resourceDetails</a> - Details about the resource
--   and utilization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_totalRunningHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The total
--   number of hours that the instance ran during the lookback period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_reservationCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The
--   number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by
--   reservations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_onDemandHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The number of
--   hours during the lookback period that's billed at On-Demand rates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monthlyCost:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_monthlyCost</a> - The current On-Demand cost of
--   operating this instance on a monthly basis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceName:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_instanceName</a> - The name that you given an
--   instance. This field shows as blank if you haven't given the instance
--   a name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod:CurrentInstance'</a>,
--   <a>currentInstance_savingsPlansCoveredHoursInLookbackPeriod</a> - The
--   number of hours during the lookback period that's covered by Savings
--   Plans.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CurrentInstance'</a>, <a>currentInstance_tags</a> - Cost
--   allocation resource tags that are applied to the instance.
newCurrentInstance :: CurrentInstance

-- | The time period of the request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDateInterval</a> smart constructor.
data DateInterval
DateInterval' :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | Create a value of <a>DateInterval</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_start</a> - The
--   beginning of the time period. The start date is inclusive. For
--   example, if <tt>start</tt> is <tt>2017-01-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services
--   retrieves cost and usage data starting at <tt>2017-01-01</tt> up to
--   the end date. The start date must be equal to or no later than the
--   current date to avoid a validation error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:DateInterval'</a>, <a>dateInterval_end</a> - The end of
--   the time period. The end date is exclusive. For example, if
--   <tt>end</tt> is <tt>2017-05-01</tt>, Amazon Web Services retrieves
--   cost and usage data from the start date up to, but not including,
--   <tt>2017-05-01</tt>.
newDateInterval :: Text -> Text -> DateInterval

-- | Use <tt>Expression</tt> to filter by cost or by usage. There are two
--   patterns:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Simple dimension values - You can set the dimension name and
--   values for the filters that you plan to use. For example, you can
--   filter for <tt>REGION==us-east-1 OR REGION==us-west-1</tt>. For
--   <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt>, the Region is a full name (for
--   example, <tt>REGION==US East (N. Virginia)</tt>. The
--   <tt>Expression</tt> example is as follows:<pre>{ "Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", “us-west-1” ] } }</pre>The
--   list of dimension values are OR'd together to retrieve cost or usage
--   data. You can create <tt>Expression</tt> and <tt>DimensionValues</tt>
--   objects using either <tt>with*</tt> methods or <tt>set*</tt> methods
--   in multiple lines.</li>
--   <li>Compound dimension values with logical operations - You can use
--   multiple <tt>Expression</tt> types and the logical operators
--   <tt>AND/OR/NOT</tt> to create a list of one or more
--   <tt>Expression</tt> objects. By doing this, you can filter on more
--   advanced options. For example, you can filter on <tt>((REGION ==
--   us-east-1 OR REGION == us-west-1) OR (TAG.Type == Type1)) AND
--   (USAGE_TYPE != DataTransfer)</tt>. The <tt>Expression</tt> for that is
--   as follows:<pre>{ "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION",
--   "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key":
--   "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": {
--   "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] }</pre>Because
--   each <tt>Expression</tt> can have only one operator, the service
--   returns an error if more than one is specified. The following example
--   shows an <tt>Expression</tt> object that creates an error.<pre> {
--   "And": [ ... ], "DimensionValues": { "Dimension": "USAGE_TYPE",
--   "Values": [ "DataTransfer" ] } }</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For the <tt>GetRightsizingRecommendation</tt> action, a combination of
--   OR and NOT isn't supported. OR isn't supported between different
--   dimensions, or dimensions and tags. NOT operators aren't supported.
--   Dimensions are also limited to <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>,
--   <tt>REGION</tt>, or <tt>RIGHTSIZING_TYPE</tt>.
--   
--   For the <tt>GetReservationPurchaseRecommendation</tt> action, only NOT
--   is supported. AND and OR aren't supported. Dimensions are limited to
--   <tt>LINKED_ACCOUNT</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExpression</a> smart constructor.
data Expression
Expression' :: Maybe Expression -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe [Expression] -> Maybe CostCategoryValues -> Maybe DimensionValues -> Maybe TagValues -> Expression

-- | Create a value of <a>Expression</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:not:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_not</a> - Return results
--   that don't match a <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_and</a> - Return results
--   that match both <tt>Dimension</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:or:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_or</a> - Return results that
--   match either <tt>Dimension</tt> object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:costCategories:Expression'</a>,
--   <a>expression_costCategories</a> - The filter that's based on
--   <tt>CostCategory</tt> values.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_dimensions</a> - The
--   specific <tt>Dimension</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Expression'</a>, <a>expression_tags</a> - The specific
--   <tt>Tag</tt> to use for <tt>Expression</tt>.
newExpression :: Expression

-- | Details about the instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that
--   you purchase.
--

--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_findingReasonCodes</a> - The list of
--   possible reasons why the recommendation is generated such as under or
--   over utilization of specific metrics (for example, CPU, Memory,
--   Network).
--

--   either terminate or modify the resource.
--

--   <a>rightsizingRecommendation_terminateRecommendationDetail</a> - The
--   details for termination recommendations.
newRightsizingRecommendation :: RightsizingRecommendation

-- | You can use <tt>RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration</tt> to
--   customize recommendations across two attributes. You can choose to
--   view recommendations for instances within the same instance families
--   or across different instance families. You can also choose to view
--   your estimated savings that are associated with recommendations with
--   consideration of existing Savings Plans or RI benefits, or neither.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRightsizingRecommendationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration
RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration' :: RecommendationTarget -> Bool -> RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration

--   all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationTarget:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_recommendationTarget</a> -
--   The option to see recommendations within the same instance family or
--   recommendations for instances across other families. The default value
--   is <tt>SAME_INSTANCE_FAMILY</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:benefitsConsidered:RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>rightsizingRecommendationConfiguration_benefitsConsidered</a> - The
--   option to consider RI or Savings Plans discount benefits in your
--   savings calculation. The default value is <tt>TRUE</tt>.
newRightsizingRecommendationConfiguration :: RecommendationTarget -> Bool -> RightsizingRecommendationConfiguration

--   Savings Plans.

--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedOnDemandCost</a>

--   recommended Savings Plans, over the length of the lookback period.
--

--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedOnDemandCostWithCurrentCommitment</a>
--   - The estimated On-Demand costs you would expect with no additional
--   commitment, based on your usage of the selected time period and the
--   Savings Plans you own.
--   
--   <a>$sel:upfrontCost:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_upfrontCost</a> - The
--   upfront cost of the recommended Savings Plans, based on the selected
--   payment option.
--

--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedSPCost</a> - The
--   cost of the recommended Savings Plans over the length of the lookback
--   period.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedSavingsPercentage:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedSavingsPercentage</a>
--   - The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost of
--   applicable On-Demand usage over the lookback period.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:estimatedAverageUtilization:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_estimatedAverageUtilization</a>
--   - The estimated utilization of the recommended Savings Plans.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:hourlyCommitmentToPurchase:SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail'</a>,
--   <a>savingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail_hourlyCommitmentToPurchase</a>
--   - The recommended hourly commitment level for the Savings Plans type
--   and the configuration that's based on the usage during the lookback
--   period.
newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationDetail

--   over the lookback period. This is calculated as
--   <tt>estimatedSavingsAmount</tt>/ <tt>CurrentOnDemandSpend</tt>*100.

--   parameters.
newSavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary :: SavingsPlansPurchaseRecommendationSummary

-- | The values that are available for a tag.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> and <tt>Key</tt> aren't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to all tags. That is,
--   it's filtered on resources with no tags.
--   
--   If <tt>Values</tt> is provided and <tt>Key</tt> isn't specified, the
--   <tt>ABSENT</tt> <tt>MatchOption</tt> is applied to the tag
--   <tt>Key</tt> only. That is, it's filtered on resources without the
--   given tag key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagValues</a> smart constructor.
data TagValues
TagValues' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MatchOption] -> TagValues

-- | Create a value of <a>TagValues</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_values</a> - The specific
--   value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_key</a> - The key for the
--   tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchOptions:TagValues'</a>, <a>tagValues_matchOptions</a> -
--   The match options that you can use to filter your results.
--   <tt>MatchOptions</tt> is only applicable for actions related to Cost
--   Category. The default values for <tt>MatchOptions</tt> are
--   <tt>EQUALS</tt> and <tt>CASE_SENSITIVE</tt>.
newTagValues :: TagValues
